5. How to Share Your Location with Someone in Find My App?

To share your location with someone in Find My app, follow these steps:

  • Step 1. Open the Find My app on your device. This app is available on Apple iPhone 6 Plus, iPad, and Mac.
  • Step 2. Tap on the “People” tab at the bottom of the screen.
  • Step 3. Tap on the “Share My Location” button.
  • Step 4. Select the contact you want to share your location with from your contacts list. If the person you want to share your location with is not in your contacts, you can manually enter their phone number or email address.
  • Step 5. Choose the duration for which you want to share your location. You can choose to share your location indefinitely or for a specific period of time.
  • Step 6. Tap on “Send” to share your location with the selected contact.

The person you shared your location with will receive a notification and will be able to see your location in the Find My app. They can also choose to share their location with you, allowing both of you to easily track each other’s whereabouts.

It’s important to note that you have control over who can see your location and for how long. You can stop sharing your location at any time by going back to the “People” tab and tapping on “Stop Sharing My Location” for the specific contact.

To know when someone stops sharing their location on Apple iPhone 6 Plus, you can follow these steps:

  • Step 1. Open the Find My app on your Apple iPhone 6 Plus.
  • Step 2. Tap on the “People” tab at the bottom of the screen.
  • Step 3. Look for the person whose location you want to track. If their location is being shared with you, their name should appear in the list.
  • Step 4. If the person has stopped sharing their location, their name will no longer appear in the list or their location will be shown as “Location Not Available.”

Alternatively, you can also try sending them a message or giving them a call to confirm if they have stopped sharing their location intentionally or if there might be any technical issues. It’s important to respect their privacy and not make any assumptions without proper communication.

entry.title: In 2024, Find My App Troubleshooting No Location Found vs. Location Not Available & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 6 | Dr.fone
entry.content:
Find My App Troubleshooting: ‘No Location Found’ vs. ‘Location Not Available’ & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 6

“What does it mean when someone’s location on Apple iPhone 6 suddenly shows “Location Not Available”? Why does it say no location found on Find My Apple iPhone 6?”

On Quora, there are many similar questions as above. Do you have the same question?

The Find My app on Apple iPhone 6 has become a powerful tool for locating lost or misplaced devices and tracking the location of family and friends. While using the app, encountering messages like “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” could be quite challenging. Understanding the distinctions between these messages within the Find My app is crucial for effectively managing and understanding location information.

In this article, we will explore the differences between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” within the Find My app on Apple iPhone 6 and will potentially address solutions to these problems.

Part 1: What Does “Location Not Available” Mean in Find My App?

If you are an Apple iPhone 6 user and frequently use the Find My app to track the location of your devices or loved ones, you may have come across the frustrating message that says “Location Not Available.” This error can leave you puzzled and wondering why you are unable to see the real-time location of the Apple iPhone 6 device you are tracking.

1.1 Understanding the “Location Not Available” Error

iPhone returning with the error “Location Not Available” involves issues caused by the Apple iPhone 6 device’s GPS. “Location Not Available” in the Find My app typically means that the Apple iPhone 6 device you are trying to locate is either turned off, not connected to the internet, or has disabled location services.

When a device is turned off or not connected to the internet, it cannot send its location information to the Find My app, thus resulting in the “Location Not Available” message. Similarly, if the Apple iPhone 6 device has disabled location services, it will not be able to provide its location to the app. It’s important to note that this message does not necessarily mean that the Apple iPhone 6 device is lost or stolen, but rather that it is unable to be tracked at that moment.

1.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 6 Say, “Location Not Available”?

The “Location Not Available” message can appear on the Find My app for various reasons. Here are some possible explanations:

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One common reason for this error is that the Apple iPhone 6 device you are trying to locate has its location services turned off. Location services are essential for apps like Find My to accurately determine the Apple iPhone 6 device’s location. To resolve this issue, the Apple iPhone 6 device owner needs to enable location services in their device settings.

  • 2. Poor or No Internet Connection

The Find My app relies on a stable internet connection to transmit location data. If the Apple iPhone 6 device you are tracking is in an area with weak or no internet connectivity, the app may not be able to retrieve the location information. Encourage the Apple iPhone 6 device owner to check their internet connection and try again later. In another case, it might be possible that your phone’s Airplane Mode is turned on, with the Wi-Fi services and cellular data turned off for the Apple iPhone 6.

  • 3. Incorrect Date and Time Settings

The “Date & Time Settings” of the Apple iPhone 6 are not set properly. You may have tried to manually set the date, time, and the appropriate zone that the Apple iPhone 6 has to follow. Technical anomalies across the settings will cause issues with the Apple iPhone 6 device’s location settings.

  • 4. Privacy Settings

Apple prioritizes user privacy, and as a result, users have control over sharing their location information. If the person you are trying to locate has set their privacy settings to restrict location sharing, you will receive a “Location Not Available” message. In this case, the Apple iPhone 6 device owner needs to adjust their privacy settings to allow location sharing with the Find My app.

  • 5. Device Turned Off or Battery Depleted

If the Apple iPhone 6 device you are tracking is turned off or its battery has completely drained, the Find My app will not be able to provide the location information. This is a common occurrence when trying to locate a lost or stolen device. In such cases, you may need to wait until the Apple iPhone 6 device is turned on or charged to retrieve its location.

  • 6. Problems with Application or Device

Occasionally, technical glitches or temporary server issues can cause the “Location Not Available” error, which will require a restart of the Apple iPhone 6 device. System issues can also cause glitches in functions like the location settings of the Apple iPhone 6, which need to be restarted. If the error persists for an extended period, it may be worth contacting Apple support for further assistance.

In conclusion, the “Location Not Available” error in the Find My app can be caused by a variety of factors, including disabled location services, poor internet connection, privacy settings, device status, or technical glitches. By understanding these possible reasons, you can troubleshoot the issue more effectively and ensure a seamless tracking experience.

Part 2: What Does “No Location Found” Mean in Find My App?

The Find My app is a useful tool that allows you to locate your Apple iPhone 6, iPad, or other Apple devices. It uses a combination of GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular data to pinpoint the exact location of your device. However, there are instances where the app fails to provide a location, leaving users confused and concerned.

### 2.1 Understanding the "No Location Found" Error

The “No Location Found” error message on your Find My app indicates that your Apple iPhone 6 is unable to determine its current location. Conveniently speaking, this error displays the unavailability of a location for an Apple iPhone 6, which is why it shows such an error. This can be frustrating, especially if you’re trying to locate a lost or stolen device. However, there are several reasons why this error may occur, and understanding them will help you troubleshoot the issue effectively.

2.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 6 Say, “No Location Found”?

There are a few common reasons why your Apple iPhone 6 may display the “No Location Found” error message. In this section, we will explore these reasons and provide solutions to help you resolve the issue.

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One possible reason for the “No Location Found” error is that your Location Services are disabled. To check if this is the case, go to your Apple iPhone 6’s Settings, tap on Privacy, and select Location Services. Ensure that the toggle switch is turned on for both the Find My app and any other apps that require location access.

  • 2. Location Not Being Shared

If you cannot find the location of your friend across the Find My App, there is a possibility that they’ve stopped sharing the location at any time. When this happens, you won’t be able to check out their live location coordinates, as the other user has voluntarily abstained from the option of showing their location to someone else.

  • 3. Device Ran Out of Battery

iPhones are Apple iPhone 6] and other smartphones that can run out of battery. While the Apple iPhone 6 needs to be activated to communicate properly, having the Apple iPhone 6 run out of battery leaves with this error when their location is searched. The Find My app would duly fail to access the Apple iPhone 6 device when it runs out of battery.

  • 4. iCloud Removed from Device

Your iCloud account plays a crucial role in the Find My app’s functionality. Apple iPhone 6 provides the “Share My Location” option for Find My users who have connected their iCloud account with their device.

If somehow they remove the iCloud account from their phone, all connections with the Apple iPhone 6 are deleted. This also includes the Find My service, which eliminates the location services from the Apple iPhone 6 device. You would now be unable to observe any location coordinates of the Apple iPhone 6 device. Sign out of your iCloud account, restart your device, and sign back in to refresh the connection. Additionally, ensure that you have enabled Find My Apple iPhone 6 in your iCloud settings.

  • 5. Poor GPS Signal or No Internet Connection

Another reason for the error message could be a weak GPS signal or lack of internet connectivity. Your Apple iPhone 6 relies on GPS and internet connection to accurately determine its location. If you’re in an area with poor GPS signal or have no internet connection, your device may struggle to find its location. Try moving to an open space or connecting to a stable internet network to see if the issue resolves.

  • 6. Outdated iOS Version

Sometimes, an outdated iOS version can cause issues with location services. Ensure that your Apple iPhone 6 is running on the latest iOS version by going to Settings, selecting General, and tapping on Software Update. If an update is available, download and install it to potentially fix any bugs or glitches affecting the Find My app’s location tracking.

  • 7. Find My Not Working Properly

Glitches in the Find My service can also cause the problem of the “No Location Found” error with the Apple iPhone 6. You won’t get any location results if the primary source has issues that cannot be quickly resolved. At times, this directs back to the server, which might take some time to correct.

Encountering the “No Location Found” error on your Apple iPhone 6’s Find My app can be frustrating, but with the information provided in this part, you now have a better understanding of why it occurs and how to troubleshoot it.

## Part 3: "No Location Found" vs. "Location Not Available" in Find My App

The “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” errors have a very thin line of difference among them. While both errors involve the inaccessibility of the location services, some causes also display similarities among them. However, there still is a difference in the errors, which is marked by the following table. With the presented distinctions, you can specify the difference between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available.”

Fake GPS Location on iOS and Android in One Click!

### What is the Difference Between Location Unavailable and No Location Found?
No Location FoundLocation Not Available / Location Unavailable
Occurs when Apple iPhone 6 is turned off or is offlineThe Find My App is turned on but is failing to update the user’s current location.
The device will be blank in color.The device will have a color and will not be generic.
Location Services across the Apple iPhone 6 might not be turned on.The “Location Services” and “Share My Location” features on Apple iPhone 6 are active and running.
It does not update the location of the person in seconds.The location is updated within seconds once the service is resumed.

In summary, “Location not available” typically refers to the temporary unavailability of location data from a device, while “No location found” indicates the inability to locate a specific device or individual at the given time.

## Part 4: How to Fix "No Location Found" or "Location Not Available" in Find My App?

We shall now start with an overview of the fixes that can be utilized to resolve the location errors in the Find My App. While the provided solutions are pretty comprehensive, different solutions can be appropriate for both problems. Thus, keep a check on the fixes and select the best option that suits your nature.

Fix 1: Checking the Apple’s System Status Page

The first thing you can do to check the location problems across the Apple iPhone 6 is to look into the status of Find My across Apple servers through Apple’s System Status page. Before you lead to perform any other action across your Apple iPhone 6, it is highly possible that the problem lies across the Apple Servers. If the service is not operational, you will find a red or yellow dot across it. Find My can be down, which is why all location errors occur across your Apple iPhone 6. For that, you have to wait for a while before the service starts running again.

### Fix 2: Change the Network Connections to Refreshing Network Settings

It is not vital to go for complicated procedures from the very start to resolve the problems of “No Location Found Apple iPhone 6”. You can seek the resolution of this problem across the network settings of your Apple iPhone 6. First, if you’ve connected your Apple iPhone 6 to a Wi-Fi network, you can shift to the cellular data network or another Wi-Fi network. Try turning off and on the services to resolve the problems across them. Changing the network settings would be effective in fixing location errors if they occur due to network inefficiencies.

_**Tips:** Fortunately, there is a reliable solution to fix this issue and get your Find My App back on track. [Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS)](https://drfone.wondershare.com/ios-system-repair.html) is a powerful tool specifically designed to troubleshoot and repair various iOS system issues, including problems with the Find My App. With just a few simple steps, you can quickly resolve the "location not available" or "no location found" error and regain full functionality of the app. Let's explore [how Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS) can help you overcome this frustrating problem](https://drfone.wondershare.com/virtual-location/no-location-found-vs-location-not-available.html#Part5.8)._

Fix 3: Turn Off the Airplane Mode across Your Apple iPhone 6

‘Does “No Location Found” mean their phone died’ is the question one might have if they face location errors while looking for their exact location. This might not be the case, as it is possible that one might have left their Airplane Mode on. Thus, the only best way to avoid this is to turn off the Airplane mode across the Apple iPhone 6. To execute this flawlessly, you need to look ahead to these simple steps:

Step 1: Access the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 6 to open the list of options available. Lead through them to find “Airplane Mode” in the list.

**Step 2:** You have to turn off the toggle adjacent to the "Airplane Mode" option for turning it off.

Fix 4: Set the Appropriate Date and Time of the Phone

The date and time settings are essential in defining the Apple iPhone 6’s location. Having the correct date and time settings is vital in avoiding issues like “Location Not Available” on your Apple iPhone 6. To prevent this from happening, you have to set the date and time of your Apple iPhone 6, which can be done as follows:

Step 1: Open the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 6 and look for “General” settings in the list of options.

Step 2: As you lead next, find the “Date & Time” settings in the options to access your Apple iPhone 6’s date and time settings.

**Step 3:** You must turn off the toggle adjacent to the "Set Automatically" option. Next, proceed to the "Time Zone" option and find the name of your city to specify the time correctly.

Click here
### Fix 5: Try Restarting Your Apple iPhone 6

If the location errors are not resolving under any defined solution, you might have to restart your Apple iPhone 6. This fixes all the prevailing glitches within the Apple iPhone 6 device, and it would be best to restart your device. However, the steps for restarting the Apple iPhone 6 differ depending on your model. Let’s look into the instructions to understand the prevailing differences:

For Apple iPhone 6 with Home Button

Step 1: To turn off an Apple iPhone 6 with the Home button, you have to hold the “Power” button on the side.

Step 2: This opens a new screen where you have to turn off the Apple iPhone 6 with the slider. As it turns off, use the Power button to start the Apple iPhone 6 again.

For Apple iPhone 6 without Home Button

Step 1: Apple iPhone 6s without the Home button can be turned off using any “Volume” button and the “Power” button. You have to hold both buttons simultaneously until the slider screen appears.

Step 2: Once you turn off the Apple iPhone 6, you need to wait a few seconds and start the Apple iPhone 6 by holding the Power button for a few seconds.

Fix 6: Enable Location Services From Apple iPhone 6 Settings

‘Does “No Location Found” mean they stopped sharing’ might be the question you would seek when you constantly are facing issues with finding a location across the Find My app. This is quite possible as the Location Services across the Apple iPhone 6 might be turned off for no particular reason. To resolve this problem, you have to follow the resolution to this problem with the following steps:

Step 1: Launch the “Settings” application on the Apple iPhone 6 and proceed into the “Privacy & Security” settings available in the list.

**Step 2:** As you lead into the next screen, find "Location Services" among the options. On accessing the "Location Services" settings, ensure that the toggle adjacent to the "Location Services" option is turned on.

Fix 7: Turning On Precise Location on Apple iPhone 6

As location issues across the Apple iPhone 6 involve the location settings, you can also look into the “Precise Location” option for resolving the prevailing problems of the Apple iPhone 6. To execute this properly and avoid all pertinent issues that are preventing you from getting a proper location across Find My, you must follow the steps to turn on Precise Location on your Apple iPhone 6:

Step 1: You must open the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 6 and search for the “Privacy & Security” option within the menu. Next, redirect to the “Location Services” section and turn it on with the available toggle.

Step 2: Following this, you need to scroll down in the same section and look for “Find My” in the options. As you proceed next, you must confirm that the blue tick is across the “Ask Time or When I Share” or “While Using the App” option. Next, ensure that the toggle of “Precise Location” is turned on.

### Fix 8: Quickly Fix Find My App Location Not Available or No Location Found Error

Considering there is no particular solution that resolves the problems of location settings across your Apple iPhone 6, you need to have a contingency plan prepared for it. Rather than taking some extreme measures, you can have the option of fixing this issue with the help of Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS) . This tool is designed to provide users with an all-in-one repair facility that fixes all Apple iPhone 6 problems without hindrance.

Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS) provides the facility of keeping the Apple iPhone 6 device’s data intact while resolving all the issues that are stopping it from functioning efficiently. You can consider using this tool to solve location issues and errors across Find My.

**Step 2:** Select Standard Mode and proceed to put the Apple iPhone 6 device in Recovery Mode to start downloading iOS firmware.

Step 3: Click “Repair Now” to start the recovery process and let the iOS firmware install on the Apple iPhone 6. Once done, tap “Done” to conclude fixing the Apple iPhone 6.

Part 5: Frequently Asked Questions about Find My App on Apple iPhone 6

Are you having trouble understanding how the Find My App works on your Apple iPhone 6? Do you have questions about certain error messages or how to share your location with others? In this part, we will answer some frequently asked questions about the Find My App on Apple iPhone 6 to help you navigate through its features and functions. Whether you’re experiencing issues with “Location Not Available” or want to know how to prevent your phone from being tracked, we’ve got you covered. Read on to find the answers to your burning questions about the Find My App.

1. Does “Location Not Available” Mean They Turned It Off?

Yes, if you are facing the problem of “Location Not Available” while using the Find My service, it might be related to the Apple iPhone 6 device being turned off. However, this is not the only case, as other issues might lead to such an error, such as networking errors and software glitches.

2. Does “No Location Found” Mean They Stopped Sharing?

Yes, if you are facing the problem of “No Location Found” while searching for a location, it might mean that the user has stopped sharing it. However, there can be other anomalies, such as the unnecessary closure of some functions or other software problems that lead to such location errors.

### 3\. How to Freeze Location on Find My Apple iPhone 6?

## How to Fix the Apple iPhone 6 GPS not Working Issue

GPS (Global Positioning System) is an important utility in this modern age. After all, it tracks an individual’s or object’s live location, making route navigation easier. Henceforth, this feature is incorporated in all modern smartphones. However, most Apple iPhone 6 users these days complain about the Apple iPhone 6 GPS problem.

As a user with daily traveling, you want to avoid such issues. This article will make things easier because you will find ways and solutions to overcome this issue.

Part 1: What Happens If Your Apple iPhone 6 GPS Does Not Work on Apple iPhone 6?

Apple iPhone 6 is among the most popular gadget devices in current times. Meanwhile, its GPS function allows users to stay active on the real-time map technology. However, GPS not working on Apple iPhone 6s is a common problem. When this happens, you cannot track pinpoint locations.

This means you will find difficulty in locating your destination. Moreover, you will not be able to use those applications that rely on GPS technology. For example, a fitness app needs to track your distance and route. Not to forget, a malfunctioning GPS may also drain more battery.

Part 2: What Are the Potential Reasons for Apple iPhone 6 GPS Not Working?

With GPS, you can track the live locations of your destination in seconds. In fact, you can also track any human depending on their live location. But as an iOS user, it’s normal to face Apple iPhone 6 GPS not working. Why does this happen? Here are the following reasons behind this error:

  • Glitches and Bugs: A most common reason for GPS not working is due to glitches and bugs. Hence, this may happen because of underlying iOS or GPS app issues. Either there was a bug in the version update, or the app is facing malfunctions.
  • Airplane Mode: When airplane mode is enabled on your Apple iPhone 6, this may cause a GPS issue. You may have forgotten to turn off your airplane mode after air travel. Not to forget, turning off GPS is necessary during flight as per regulations.
  • Incorrect Settings: It’s possible that GPS settings are not properly configured on your Apple iPhone 6. Like, you may have accidentally turned off location services. While using your Apple iPhone 6, turning on and off certain features is common.
  • Hardware Issue: If your phone is exposed to water or physical damage, this may affect GPS. There may be a hardware issue caused due to this situation. Thus, the GPS antenna or chip may have been damaged.
## Part 3: How To Fix Apple iPhone 6 GPS Not Working?

Having an erroneous Apple iPhone 6 GPS is not a new thing. But it does bring many inconveniences for the users. After all, you are deprived of live location tracking and positioning. To fix such Apple iPhone 6 GPS not working issues, these ways are ideal solutions:

Way 1: Make Sure GPS Service is Enabled on Apple iPhone 6

A majority of people forget to turn on GPS services on their respective Apple iPhone 6s. Thus, most times, users don’t know how to turn on GPS back. Henceforth, GPS not working issues become evident. To enable GPS service on Apple iPhone 6, follow these steps:  

  • Step 1: Launch your Apple iPhone 6 Settings, scroll down, and find “Privacy & Security” from the menu.

  • Step 2: Press “Privacy & Security” and turn on “Location Services” to enable GPS. You can also enable location for other apps from the same settings.

### Way 2: Simple Restart Apple iPhone 6

Restarting an Apple iPhone 6 is the ultimate way to rectify underlying problems. Sometimes GPS is not working because of cache or network problems, and restarting Apple iPhone 6 can help. For restarting an Apple iPhone 6, these steps will help you:

  • Step 1: From the Apple iPhone 6 settings, move into the “General” category, scroll down, and press “Shut Down.” Now slide right to power off your Apple iPhone 6.

  • Step 2: Wait for some time till your device gets powered off. After this, hold the “Power” button until the Apple logo appears to restart your device.
### Way 3: Force Restart Apple iPhone 6

Sometimes your Apple iPhone 6 may get hung up due to an underlying issue. So, when your device is not responding, you cannot restart it from settings. In this scenario, you need to force restart Apple iPhone 6. To do this, perform these simple instructions:

  • Apple iPhone 6 6, 6S Plus, and Older: Simultaneously press and hold the “Home” and “Sleep/Wake” buttons. Make sure to keep holding both buttons until you see the Apple logo. Finally, release the buttons when the logo appears.
  • Apple iPhone 6 7 or 7 Plus: Start by holding the “Sleep/Wake” button and “Volume Down” button at the same time. Afterward, stop holding the buttons and release them when you see the Apple logo.
  • Apple iPhone 6 8 and Later: Initially, quickly press and release the “Volume Up” button, then perform the same with the “Volume Down” button. After this, press and hold the “Sleep/Wake” button, and release the button once the Apple logo appears.

### Way 4: Reset Network Settings

A network connection error is also the reason for Apple iPhone 6 GPS not working. This happens when your Apple iPhone 6 isn’t connected to a Wi-Fi network or facing problems in connection. For resetting the network settings, these steps are your trusted solution.

  • Step 1: From your Apple iPhone 6, launch “Settings,” scroll down, and move into “General” from the settings menu.

  • Step 2: Access the “Transfer or Reset Apple iPhone 6” options, tap the “Reset” option, and select “Reset Network Settings.” Now reset your Apple iPhone 6 network settings to default by tapping “Reset Network Settings.”

### Way 5: Reset Location and Privacy Settings

In most scenarios, your location is used on many apps that risk GPS optimal functioning. For this purpose, you need to reset the location to the default factory settings. Thinking about how to do it? Get along with these steps:

  • Step 1: Move into the settings of your Apple iPhone 6, scroll down, and tap “General” from the available options.

  • Step 2: Now press the “Transfer or Reset Apple iPhone 6” option from General. From the next screen, choose the “Reset” option, and select “Reset Location & Privacy.” After pressing “Reset Settings,” your device location settings will reset to default.

entry.title: In 2024, Find My App Troubleshooting No Location Found vs. Location Not Available & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max | Dr.fone
entry.content:
Find My App Troubleshooting: ‘No Location Found’ vs. ‘Location Not Available’ & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max

“What does it mean when someone’s location on Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max suddenly shows “Location Not Available”? Why does it say no location found on Find My Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max?”

On Quora, there are many similar questions as above. Do you have the same question?

The Find My app on Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max has become a powerful tool for locating lost or misplaced devices and tracking the location of family and friends. While using the app, encountering messages like “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” could be quite challenging. Understanding the distinctions between these messages within the Find My app is crucial for effectively managing and understanding location information.

In this article, we will explore the differences between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” within the Find My app on Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max and will potentially address solutions to these problems.

Part 1: What Does “Location Not Available” Mean in Find My App?

If you are an Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max user and frequently use the Find My app to track the location of your devices or loved ones, you may have come across the frustrating message that says “Location Not Available.” This error can leave you puzzled and wondering why you are unable to see the real-time location of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device you are tracking.

1.1 Understanding the “Location Not Available” Error

iPhone returning with the error “Location Not Available” involves issues caused by the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device’s GPS. “Location Not Available” in the Find My app typically means that the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device you are trying to locate is either turned off, not connected to the internet, or has disabled location services.

When a device is turned off or not connected to the internet, it cannot send its location information to the Find My app, thus resulting in the “Location Not Available” message. Similarly, if the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device has disabled location services, it will not be able to provide its location to the app. It’s important to note that this message does not necessarily mean that the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device is lost or stolen, but rather that it is unable to be tracked at that moment.

1.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max Say, “Location Not Available”?

The “Location Not Available” message can appear on the Find My app for various reasons. Here are some possible explanations:

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One common reason for this error is that the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device you are trying to locate has its location services turned off. Location services are essential for apps like Find My to accurately determine the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device’s location. To resolve this issue, the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device owner needs to enable location services in their device settings.

  • 2. Poor or No Internet Connection

The Find My app relies on a stable internet connection to transmit location data. If the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device you are tracking is in an area with weak or no internet connectivity, the app may not be able to retrieve the location information. Encourage the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device owner to check their internet connection and try again later. In another case, it might be possible that your phone’s Airplane Mode is turned on, with the Wi-Fi services and cellular data turned off for the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max.

  • 3. Incorrect Date and Time Settings

The “Date & Time Settings” of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max are not set properly. You may have tried to manually set the date, time, and the appropriate zone that the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max has to follow. Technical anomalies across the settings will cause issues with the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device’s location settings.

  • 4. Privacy Settings

Apple prioritizes user privacy, and as a result, users have control over sharing their location information. If the person you are trying to locate has set their privacy settings to restrict location sharing, you will receive a “Location Not Available” message. In this case, the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device owner needs to adjust their privacy settings to allow location sharing with the Find My app.

  • 5. Device Turned Off or Battery Depleted

If the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device you are tracking is turned off or its battery has completely drained, the Find My app will not be able to provide the location information. This is a common occurrence when trying to locate a lost or stolen device. In such cases, you may need to wait until the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device is turned on or charged to retrieve its location.

Occasionally, technical glitches or temporary server issues can cause the “Location Not Available” error, which will require a restart of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device. System issues can also cause glitches in functions like the location settings of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max, which need to be restarted. If the error persists for an extended period, it may be worth contacting Apple support for further assistance.

In conclusion, the “Location Not Available” error in the Find My app can be caused by a variety of factors, including disabled location services, poor internet connection, privacy settings, device status, or technical glitches. Part 2: What Does “No Location Found” Mean in Find My App?

The Find My app is a useful tool that allows you to locate your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max, iPad, or other Apple devices. It uses a combination of GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular data to pinpoint the exact location of your device. However, there are instances where the app fails to provide a location, leaving users confused and concerned.

### 2.1 Understanding the "No Location Found" Error

The “No Location Found” error message on your Find My app indicates that your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max is unable to determine its current location. Conveniently speaking, this error displays the unavailability of a location for an Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max, which is why it shows such an error. This can be frustrating, especially if you’re trying to locate a lost or stolen device. However, there are several reasons why this error may occur, and understanding them will help you troubleshoot the issue effectively.

2.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max Say, “No Location Found”?

There are a few common reasons why your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max may display the “No Location Found” error message. In this section, we will explore these reasons and provide solutions to help you resolve the issue.

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One possible reason for the “No Location Found” error is that your Location Services are disabled. To check if this is the case, go to your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max’s Settings, tap on Privacy, and select Location Services. Ensure that the toggle switch is turned on for both the Find My app and any other apps that require location access.

  • 2. Location Not Being Shared

If you cannot find the location of your friend across the Find My App, there is a possibility that they’ve stopped sharing the location at any time. When this happens, you won’t be able to check out their live location coordinates, as the other user has voluntarily abstained from the option of showing their location to someone else.

  • 3. Device Ran Out of Battery

iPhones are Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max] and other smartphones that can run out of battery. While the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max needs to be activated to communicate properly, having the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max run out of battery leaves with this error when their location is searched. The Find My app would duly fail to access the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device when it runs out of battery.

  • 4. iCloud Removed from Device

Your iCloud account plays a crucial role in the Find My app’s functionality. Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max provides the “Share My Location” option for Find My users who have connected their iCloud account with their device.

If somehow they remove the iCloud account from their phone, all connections with the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max are deleted. This also includes the Find My service, which eliminates the location services from the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device. You would now be unable to observe any location coordinates of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max device. Sign out of your iCloud account, restart your device, and sign back in to refresh the connection. Additionally, ensure that you have enabled Find My Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max in your iCloud settings.

  • 5. Poor GPS Signal or No Internet Connection

Another reason for the error message could be a weak GPS signal or lack of internet connectivity. Your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max relies on GPS and internet connection to accurately determine its location. If you’re in an area with poor GPS signal or have no internet connection, your device may struggle to find its location. Try moving to an open space or connecting to a stable internet network to see if the issue resolves.

  • 6. Outdated iOS Version

Sometimes, an outdated iOS version can cause issues with location services. Ensure that your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max is running on the latest iOS version by going to Settings, selecting General, and tapping on Software Update. If an update is available, download and install it to potentially fix any bugs or glitches affecting the Find My app’s location tracking.

  • 7. Find My Not Working Properly

Glitches in the Find My service can also cause the problem of the “No Location Found” error with the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max. You won’t get any location results if the primary source has issues that cannot be quickly resolved. At times, this directs back to the server, which might take some time to correct.

Encountering the “No Location Found” error on your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max’s Find My app can be frustrating, but with the information provided in this part, you now have a better understanding of why it occurs and how to troubleshoot it.

How to Fix the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max GPS not Working Issue

GPS (Global Positioning System) is an important utility in this modern age. After all, it tracks an individual’s or object’s live location, making route navigation easier. Henceforth, this feature is incorporated in all modern smartphones. However, most Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max users these days complain about the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max GPS problem.

As a user with daily traveling, you want to avoid such issues. This article will make things easier because you will find ways and solutions to overcome this issue.

Part 1: What Happens If Your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max GPS Does Not Work on Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max?

Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max is among the most popular gadget devices in current times. Meanwhile, its GPS function allows users to stay active on the real-time map technology. However, GPS not working on Apple iPhone 15 Pro Maxs is a common problem. When this happens, you cannot track pinpoint locations.

This means you will find difficulty in locating your destination. Moreover, you will not be able to use those applications that rely on GPS technology. For example, a fitness app needs to track your distance and route. Not to forget, a malfunctioning GPS may also drain more battery.

Part 2: What Are the Potential Reasons for Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max GPS Not Working?

With GPS, you can track the live locations of your destination in seconds. In fact, you can also track any human depending on their live location. But as an iOS user, it’s normal to face Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max GPS not working. Why does this happen? Here are the following reasons behind this error:

  • Glitches and Bugs: A most common reason for GPS not working is due to glitches and bugs. Hence, this may happen because of underlying iOS or GPS app issues. Either there was a bug in the version update, or the app is facing malfunctions.
  • Airplane Mode: When airplane mode is enabled on your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max, this may cause a GPS issue. You may have forgotten to turn off your airplane mode after air travel. Not to forget, turning off GPS is necessary during flight as per regulations.
  • Incorrect Settings: It’s possible that GPS settings are not properly configured on your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max. Like, you may have accidentally turned off location services. While using your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max, turning on and off certain features is common.
  • Hardware Issue: If your phone is exposed to water or physical damage, this may affect GPS. There may be a hardware issue caused due to this situation. Thus, the GPS antenna or chip may have been damaged.
## Part 3: How To Fix Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max GPS Not Working?

Having an erroneous Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max GPS is not a new thing. But it does bring many inconveniences for the users. After all, you are deprived of live location tracking and positioning. To fix such Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max GPS not working issues, these ways are ideal solutions:

### Way 1: Make Sure GPS Service is Enabled on Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max

A majority of people forget to turn on GPS services on their respective Apple iPhone 15 Pro Maxs. Thus, most times, users don’t know how to turn on GPS back. Henceforth, GPS not working issues become evident. To enable GPS service on Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max, follow these steps:  

  • Step 1: Launch your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max Settings, scroll down, and find “Privacy & Security” from the menu.

  • Step 2: Press “Privacy & Security” and turn on “Location Services” to enable GPS. You can also enable location for other apps from the same settings.

Way 2: Simple Restart Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max

Restarting an Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max is the ultimate way to rectify underlying problems. Sometimes GPS is not working because of cache or network problems, and restarting Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max can help. For restarting an Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max, these steps will help you:

  • Step 1: From the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max settings, move into the “General” category, scroll down, and press “Shut Down.” Now slide right to power off your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max.

- ****Step 2:**** Wait for some time till your device gets powered off. After this, hold the “Power” button until the Apple logo appears to restart your device.

Way 3: Force Restart Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max

Sometimes your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max may get hung up due to an underlying issue. So, when your device is not responding, you cannot restart it from settings. In this scenario, you need to force restart Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max. To do this, perform these simple instructions:

  • Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max 6, 6S Plus, and Older: Simultaneously press and hold the “Home” and “Sleep/Wake” buttons. Make sure to keep holding both buttons until you see the Apple logo. Finally, release the buttons when the logo appears.
  • Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max 7 or 7 Plus: Start by holding the “Sleep/Wake” button and “Volume Down” button at the same time. Afterward, stop holding the buttons and release them when you see the Apple logo.
  • Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max 8 and Later: Initially, quickly press and release the “Volume Up” button, then perform the same with the “Volume Down” button. After this, press and hold the “Sleep/Wake” button, and release the button once the Apple logo appears.

Way 4: Reset Network Settings

A network connection error is also the reason for Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max GPS not working. This happens when your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max isn’t connected to a Wi-Fi network or facing problems in connection. For resetting the network settings, these steps are your trusted solution.

  • Step 1: From your Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max, launch “Settings,” scroll down, and move into “General” from the settings menu.

entry.title: In 2024, Find My App Troubleshooting No Location Found vs. Location Not Available & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 15 Pro | Dr.fone
entry.content:
Find My App Troubleshooting: ‘No Location Found’ vs. ‘Location Not Available’ & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 15 Pro

“What does it mean when someone’s location on Apple iPhone 15 Pro suddenly shows “Location Not Available”? Why does it say no location found on Find My Apple iPhone 15 Pro?”

On Quora, there are many similar questions as above. Do you have the same question?

The Find My app on Apple iPhone 15 Pro has become a powerful tool for locating lost or misplaced devices and tracking the location of family and friends. While using the app, encountering messages like “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” could be quite challenging. Understanding the distinctions between these messages within the Find My app is crucial for effectively managing and understanding location information.

In this article, we will explore the differences between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” within the Find My app on Apple iPhone 15 Pro and will potentially address solutions to these problems.

Part 1: What Does “Location Not Available” Mean in Find My App?

If you are an Apple iPhone 15 Pro user and frequently use the Find My app to track the location of your devices or loved ones, you may have come across the frustrating message that says “Location Not Available.” This error can leave you puzzled and wondering why you are unable to see the real-time location of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device you are tracking.

1.1 Understanding the “Location Not Available” Error

iPhone returning with the error “Location Not Available” involves issues caused by the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device’s GPS. “Location Not Available” in the Find My app typically means that the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device you are trying to locate is either turned off, not connected to the internet, or has disabled location services.

When a device is turned off or not connected to the internet, it cannot send its location information to the Find My app, thus resulting in the “Location Not Available” message. Similarly, if the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device has disabled location services, it will not be able to provide its location to the app. It’s important to note that this message does not necessarily mean that the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device is lost or stolen, but rather that it is unable to be tracked at that moment.

1.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 15 Pro Say, “Location Not Available”?

The “Location Not Available” message can appear on the Find My app for various reasons. Here are some possible explanations:

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One common reason for this error is that the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device you are trying to locate has its location services turned off. Location services are essential for apps like Find My to accurately determine the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device’s location. To resolve this issue, the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device owner needs to enable location services in their device settings.

  • 2. Poor or No Internet Connection

The Find My app relies on a stable internet connection to transmit location data. If the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device you are tracking is in an area with weak or no internet connectivity, the app may not be able to retrieve the location information. Encourage the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device owner to check their internet connection and try again later. In another case, it might be possible that your phone’s Airplane Mode is turned on, with the Wi-Fi services and cellular data turned off for the Apple iPhone 15 Pro.

  • 3. Incorrect Date and Time Settings

The “Date & Time Settings” of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro are not set properly. You may have tried to manually set the date, time, and the appropriate zone that the Apple iPhone 15 Pro has to follow. Technical anomalies across the settings will cause issues with the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device’s location settings.

  • 4. Privacy Settings

Apple prioritizes user privacy, and as a result, users have control over sharing their location information. If the person you are trying to locate has set their privacy settings to restrict location sharing, you will receive a “Location Not Available” message. In this case, the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device owner needs to adjust their privacy settings to allow location sharing with the Find My app.

  • 5. Device Turned Off or Battery Depleted

If the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device you are tracking is turned off or its battery has completely drained, the Find My app will not be able to provide the location information. This is a common occurrence when trying to locate a lost or stolen device. In such cases, you may need to wait until the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device is turned on or charged to retrieve its location.

  • 6. Problems with Application or Device

Occasionally, technical glitches or temporary server issues can cause the “Location Not Available” error, which will require a restart of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device. System issues can also cause glitches in functions like the location settings of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro, which need to be restarted. If the error persists for an extended period, it may be worth contacting Apple support for further assistance.

In conclusion, the “Location Not Available” error in the Find My app can be caused by a variety of factors, including disabled location services, poor internet connection, privacy settings, device status, or technical glitches. By understanding these possible reasons, you can troubleshoot the issue more effectively and ensure a seamless tracking experience.

Click here
## Part 2: What Does "No Location Found" Mean in Find My App?

The Find My app is a useful tool that allows you to locate your Apple iPhone 15 Pro, iPad, or other Apple devices. It uses a combination of GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular data to pinpoint the exact location of your device. However, there are instances where the app fails to provide a location, leaving users confused and concerned.

2.1 Understanding the “No Location Found” Error

The “No Location Found” error message on your Find My app indicates that your Apple iPhone 15 Pro is unable to determine its current location. Conveniently speaking, this error displays the unavailability of a location for an Apple iPhone 15 Pro, which is why it shows such an error. This can be frustrating, especially if you’re trying to locate a lost or stolen device. However, there are several reasons why this error may occur, and understanding them will help you troubleshoot the issue effectively.

Click here
### 2.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 15 Pro Say, "No Location Found"?

There are a few common reasons why your Apple iPhone 15 Pro may display the “No Location Found” error message. In this section, we will explore these reasons and provide solutions to help you resolve the issue.

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One possible reason for the “No Location Found” error is that your Location Services are disabled. To check if this is the case, go to your Apple iPhone 15 Pro’s Settings, tap on Privacy, and select Location Services. Ensure that the toggle switch is turned on for both the Find My app and any other apps that require location access.

  • 2. Location Not Being Shared

If you cannot find the location of your friend across the Find My App, there is a possibility that they’ve stopped sharing the location at any time. When this happens, you won’t be able to check out their live location coordinates, as the other user has voluntarily abstained from the option of showing their location to someone else.

  • 3. Device Ran Out of Battery

iPhones are Apple iPhone 15 Pro] and other smartphones that can run out of battery. While the Apple iPhone 15 Pro needs to be activated to communicate properly, having the Apple iPhone 15 Pro run out of battery leaves with this error when their location is searched. The Find My app would duly fail to access the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device when it runs out of battery.

  • 4. iCloud Removed from Device

Your iCloud account plays a crucial role in the Find My app’s functionality. Apple iPhone 15 Pro provides the “Share My Location” option for Find My users who have connected their iCloud account with their device.

If somehow they remove the iCloud account from their phone, all connections with the Apple iPhone 15 Pro are deleted. This also includes the Find My service, which eliminates the location services from the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device. You would now be unable to observe any location coordinates of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device. Sign out of your iCloud account, restart your device, and sign back in to refresh the connection. Additionally, ensure that you have enabled Find My Apple iPhone 15 Pro in your iCloud settings.

  • 5. Poor GPS Signal or No Internet Connection

Another reason for the error message could be a weak GPS signal or lack of internet connectivity. Your Apple iPhone 15 Pro relies on GPS and internet connection to accurately determine its location. If you’re in an area with poor GPS signal or have no internet connection, your device may struggle to find its location. Try moving to an open space or connecting to a stable internet network to see if the issue resolves.

  • 6. Outdated iOS Version

Sometimes, an outdated iOS version can cause issues with location services. Ensure that your Apple iPhone 15 Pro is running on the latest iOS version by going to Settings, selecting General, and tapping on Software Update. If an update is available, download and install it to potentially fix any bugs or glitches affecting the Find My app’s location tracking.

  • 7. Find My Not Working Properly

Glitches in the Find My service can also cause the problem of the “No Location Found” error with the Apple iPhone 15 Pro. You won’t get any location results if the primary source has issues that cannot be quickly resolved. At times, this directs back to the server, which might take some time to correct.

Encountering the “No Location Found” error on your Apple iPhone 15 Pro’s Find My app can be frustrating, but with the information provided in this part, you now have a better understanding of why it occurs and how to troubleshoot it.

Click here
## Part 3: "No Location Found" vs. "Location Not Available" in Find My App

The “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” errors have a very thin line of difference among them. While both errors involve the inaccessibility of the location services, some causes also display similarities among them. However, there still is a difference in the errors, which is marked by the following table. With the presented distinctions, you can specify the difference between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available.”

Fake GPS Location on iOS and Android in One Click!

### What is the Difference Between Location Unavailable and No Location Found?
No Location FoundLocation Not Available / Location Unavailable
Occurs when Apple iPhone 15 Pro is turned off or is offlineThe Find My App is turned on but is failing to update the user’s current location.
The device will be blank in color.The device will have a color and will not be generic.
Location Services across the Apple iPhone 15 Pro might not be turned on.The “Location Services” and “Share My Location” features on Apple iPhone 15 Pro are active and running.
It does not update the location of the person in seconds.The location is updated within seconds once the service is resumed.

In summary, “Location not available” typically refers to the temporary unavailability of location data from a device, while “No location found” indicates the inability to locate a specific device or individual at the given time.

## Part 4: How to Fix "No Location Found" or "Location Not Available" in Find My App?

We shall now start with an overview of the fixes that can be utilized to resolve the location errors in the Find My App. While the provided solutions are pretty comprehensive, different solutions can be appropriate for both problems. Thus, keep a check on the fixes and select the best option that suits your nature.

Fix 1: Checking the Apple’s System Status Page

The first thing you can do to check the location problems across the Apple iPhone 15 Pro is to look into the status of Find My across Apple servers through Apple’s System Status page. Before you lead to perform any other action across your Apple iPhone 15 Pro, it is highly possible that the problem lies across the Apple Servers. If the service is not operational, you will find a red or yellow dot across it. Find My can be down, which is why all location errors occur across your Apple iPhone 15 Pro. For that, you have to wait for a while before the service starts running again.

### Fix 2: Change the Network Connections to Refreshing Network Settings

It is not vital to go for complicated procedures from the very start to resolve the problems of “No Location Found Apple iPhone 15 Pro”. You can seek the resolution of this problem across the network settings of your Apple iPhone 15 Pro. First, if you’ve connected your Apple iPhone 15 Pro to a Wi-Fi network, you can shift to the cellular data network or another Wi-Fi network. Try turning off and on the services to resolve the problems across them. Changing the network settings would be effective in fixing location errors if they occur due to network inefficiencies.

_**Tips:** Fortunately, there is a reliable solution to fix this issue and get your Find My App back on track. [Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS)](https://drfone.wondershare.com/ios-system-repair.html) is a powerful tool specifically designed to troubleshoot and repair various iOS system issues, including problems with the Find My App. With just a few simple steps, you can quickly resolve the "location not available" or "no location found" error and regain full functionality of the app. Let's explore [how Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS) can help you overcome this frustrating problem](https://drfone.wondershare.com/virtual-location/no-location-found-vs-location-not-available.html#Part5.8)._

Fix 3: Turn Off the Airplane Mode across Your Apple iPhone 15 Pro

‘Does “No Location Found” mean their phone died’ is the question one might have if they face location errors while looking for their exact location. This might not be the case, as it is possible that one might have left their Airplane Mode on. Thus, the only best way to avoid this is to turn off the Airplane mode across the Apple iPhone 15 Pro. To execute this flawlessly, you need to look ahead to these simple steps:

Step 1: Access the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 15 Pro to open the list of options available. Lead through them to find “Airplane Mode” in the list.

Step 2: You have to turn off the toggle adjacent to the “Airplane Mode” option for turning it off.

### Fix 4: Set the Appropriate Date and Time of the Phone

The date and time settings are essential in defining the Apple iPhone 15 Pro’s location. Having the correct date and time settings is vital in avoiding issues like “Location Not Available” on your Apple iPhone 15 Pro. To prevent this from happening, you have to set the date and time of your Apple iPhone 15 Pro, which can be done as follows:

Step 1: Open the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 15 Pro and look for “General” settings in the list of options.

**Step 2:** As you lead next, find the "Date & Time" settings in the options to access your Apple iPhone 15 Pro's date and time settings.

**Step 3:** You must turn off the toggle adjacent to the "Set Automatically" option. Next, proceed to the "Time Zone" option and find the name of your city to specify the time correctly.

### Fix 5: Try Restarting Your Apple iPhone 15 Pro

If the location errors are not resolving under any defined solution, you might have to restart your Apple iPhone 15 Pro. This fixes all the prevailing glitches within the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device, and it would be best to restart your device. However, the steps for restarting the Apple iPhone 15 Pro differ depending on your model. Let’s look into the instructions to understand the prevailing differences:

For Apple iPhone 15 Pro with Home Button

Step 1: To turn off an Apple iPhone 15 Pro with the Home button, you have to hold the “Power” button on the side.

Step 2: This opens a new screen where you have to turn off the Apple iPhone 15 Pro with the slider. As it turns off, use the Power button to start the Apple iPhone 15 Pro again.

**For Apple iPhone 15 Pro without Home Button**

Step 1: Apple iPhone 15 Pros without the Home button can be turned off using any “Volume” button and the “Power” button. You have to hold both buttons simultaneously until the slider screen appears.

**Step 2:** Once you turn off the Apple iPhone 15 Pro, you need to wait a few seconds and start the Apple iPhone 15 Pro by holding the Power button for a few seconds. ### Fix 6: Enable Location Services From Apple iPhone 15 Pro Settings

‘Does “No Location Found” mean they stopped sharing’ might be the question you would seek when you constantly are facing issues with finding a location across the Find My app. This is quite possible as the Location Services across the Apple iPhone 15 Pro might be turned off for no particular reason. To resolve this problem, you have to follow the resolution to this problem with the following steps:

Step 1: Launch the “Settings” application on the Apple iPhone 15 Pro and proceed into the “Privacy & Security” settings available in the list.

Step 2: As you lead into the next screen, find “Location Services” among the options. On accessing the “Location Services” settings, ensure that the toggle adjacent to the “Location Services” option is turned on.

Click here
### Fix 7: Turning On Precise Location on Apple iPhone 15 Pro

As location issues across the Apple iPhone 15 Pro involve the location settings, you can also look into the “Precise Location” option for resolving the prevailing problems of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro. To execute this properly and avoid all pertinent issues that are preventing you from getting a proper location across Find My, you must follow the steps to turn on Precise Location on your Apple iPhone 15 Pro:

Step 1: You must open the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 15 Pro and search for the “Privacy & Security” option within the menu. Next, redirect to the “Location Services” section and turn it on with the available toggle.

**Step 2:** Following this, you need to scroll down in the same section and look for "Find My" in the options. As you proceed next, you must confirm that the blue tick is across the "Ask Time or When I Share" or "While Using the App" option. Next, ensure that the toggle of "Precise Location" is turned on.

Considering there is no particular solution that resolves the problems of location settings across your Apple iPhone 15 Pro, you need to have a contingency plan prepared for it. Rather than taking some extreme measures, you can have the option of fixing this issue with the help of Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS) . ## Part 5: Frequently Asked Questions about Find My App on Apple iPhone 15 Pro

Are you having trouble understanding how the Find My App works on your Apple iPhone 15 Pro? Do you have questions about certain error messages or how to share your location with others? In this part, we will answer some frequently asked questions about the Find My App on Apple iPhone 15 Pro to help you navigate through its features and functions. Whether you’re experiencing issues with “Location Not Available” or want to know how to prevent your phone from being tracked, we’ve got you covered. Read on to find the answers to your burning questions about the Find My App.

1. Does “Location Not Available” Mean They Turned It Off?

Yes, if you are facing the problem of “Location Not Available” while using the Find My service, it might be related to the Apple iPhone 15 Pro device being turned off. However, this is not the only case, as other issues might lead to such an error, such as networking errors and software glitches.

2. Does “No Location Found” Mean They Stopped Sharing?

Yes, if you are facing the problem of “No Location Found” while searching for a location, it might mean that the user has stopped sharing it. However, there can be other anomalies, such as the unnecessary closure of some functions or other software problems that lead to such location errors.

3. How to Freeze Location on Find My Apple iPhone 15 Pro?

If you wish to freeze the location on Find My app, you will have to open the “Privacy & Security” settings on your Apple iPhone 15 Pro and close down the Location Services to freeze the location.

4. How to Prevent Your Apple iPhone 15 Pro from Being Tracked?

To prevent getting tracked, you can use the Dr.Fone - Virtual Location tool to spoof your Apple iPhone 15 Pro location anywhere in the world. This is how you can prevent other users from tracking your location.

Tips: With Dr.Fone - Virtual Location (iOS/Android) you can freely change your GPS location to anywhere without jailbreak! Also, it enables you to simulate GPS movement with the joystick, customized speeds, and imported GPX route files.

5. How to Share Your Location with Someone in Find My App?

To share your location with someone in Find My app, follow these steps:

  • Step 1. Open the Find My app on your device. This app is available on Apple iPhone 15 Pro, iPad, and Mac.
  • Step 2. Tap on the “People” tab at the bottom of the screen.
  • Step 3. Tap on the “Share My Location” button.
  • Step 4. Select the contact you want to share your location with from your contacts list. If the person you want to share your location with is not in your contacts, you can manually enter their phone number or email address.
  • Step 5. Choose the duration for which you want to share your location. You can choose to share your location indefinitely or for a specific period of time.
  • Step 6. Tap on “Send” to share your location with the selected contact.

The person you shared your location with will receive a notification and will be able to see your location in the Find My app. They can also choose to share their location with you, allowing both of you to easily track each other’s whereabouts.

It’s important to note that you have control over who can see your location and for how long. You can stop sharing your location at any time by going back to the “People” tab and tapping on “Stop Sharing My Location” for the specific contact.

### 6\. How Do You Know When Someone Stops Sharing Their Location on Apple iPhone 15 Pro?

To know when someone stops sharing their location on Apple iPhone 15 Pro, you can follow these steps:

  • Step 1. Open the Find My app on your Apple iPhone 15 Pro.
  • Step 2. Tap on the “People” tab at the bottom of the screen.
  • Step 3. Look for the person whose location you want to track. If their location is being shared with you, their name should appear in the list.
