entry.title: In 2024, Find My App Troubleshooting No Location Found vs. Location Not Available & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 15 Plus | Dr.fone
entry.content:
Find My App Troubleshooting: ‘No Location Found’ vs. ‘Location Not Available’ & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 15 Plus

“What does it mean when someone’s location on Apple iPhone 15 Plus suddenly shows “Location Not Available”? Why does it say no location found on Find My Apple iPhone 15 Plus?”

On Quora, there are many similar questions as above. Do you have the same question?

The Find My app on Apple iPhone 15 Plus has become a powerful tool for locating lost or misplaced devices and tracking the location of family and friends. While using the app, encountering messages like “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” could be quite challenging. Understanding the distinctions between these messages within the Find My app is crucial for effectively managing and understanding location information.

In this article, we will explore the differences between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” within the Find My app on Apple iPhone 15 Plus and will potentially address solutions to these problems.

Part 1: What Does “Location Not Available” Mean in Find My App?

If you are an Apple iPhone 15 Plus user and frequently use the Find My app to track the location of your devices or loved ones, you may have come across the frustrating message that says “Location Not Available.” This error can leave you puzzled and wondering why you are unable to see the real-time location of the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device you are tracking.

1.1 Understanding the “Location Not Available” Error

iPhone returning with the error “Location Not Available” involves issues caused by the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device’s GPS. “Location Not Available” in the Find My app typically means that the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device you are trying to locate is either turned off, not connected to the internet, or has disabled location services.

When a device is turned off or not connected to the internet, it cannot send its location information to the Find My app, thus resulting in the “Location Not Available” message. Similarly, if the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device has disabled location services, it will not be able to provide its location to the app. It’s important to note that this message does not necessarily mean that the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device is lost or stolen, but rather that it is unable to be tracked at that moment.

1.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 15 Plus Say, “Location Not Available”?

The “Location Not Available” message can appear on the Find My app for various reasons. Here are some possible explanations:

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One common reason for this error is that the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device you are trying to locate has its location services turned off. Location services are essential for apps like Find My to accurately determine the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device’s location. To resolve this issue, the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device owner needs to enable location services in their device settings.

  • 2. Poor or No Internet Connection

The Find My app relies on a stable internet connection to transmit location data. If the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device you are tracking is in an area with weak or no internet connectivity, the app may not be able to retrieve the location information. Encourage the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device owner to check their internet connection and try again later. In another case, it might be possible that your phone’s Airplane Mode is turned on, with the Wi-Fi services and cellular data turned off for the Apple iPhone 15 Plus.

  • 3. Incorrect Date and Time Settings

The “Date & Time Settings” of the Apple iPhone 15 Plus are not set properly. You may have tried to manually set the date, time, and the appropriate zone that the Apple iPhone 15 Plus has to follow. Technical anomalies across the settings will cause issues with the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device’s location settings.

  • 4. Privacy Settings

Apple prioritizes user privacy, and as a result, users have control over sharing their location information. If the person you are trying to locate has set their privacy settings to restrict location sharing, you will receive a “Location Not Available” message. In this case, the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device owner needs to adjust their privacy settings to allow location sharing with the Find My app.

  • 5. Device Turned Off or Battery Depleted

If the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device you are tracking is turned off or its battery has completely drained, the Find My app will not be able to provide the location information. This is a common occurrence when trying to locate a lost or stolen device. In such cases, you may need to wait until the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device is turned on or charged to retrieve its location.

  • 6. Problems with Application or Device

Occasionally, technical glitches or temporary server issues can cause the “Location Not Available” error, which will require a restart of the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device. System issues can also cause glitches in functions like the location settings of the Apple iPhone 15 Plus, which need to be restarted. If the error persists for an extended period, it may be worth contacting Apple support for further assistance.

In conclusion, the “Location Not Available” error in the Find My app can be caused by a variety of factors, including disabled location services, poor internet connection, privacy settings, device status, or technical glitches. By understanding these possible reasons, you can troubleshoot the issue more effectively and ensure a seamless tracking experience.

Part 2: What Does “No Location Found” Mean in Find My App?

The Find My app is a useful tool that allows you to locate your Apple iPhone 15 Plus, iPad, or other Apple devices. It uses a combination of GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular data to pinpoint the exact location of your device. However, there are instances where the app fails to provide a location, leaving users confused and concerned.

### 2.1 Understanding the "No Location Found" Error

The “No Location Found” error message on your Find My app indicates that your Apple iPhone 15 Plus is unable to determine its current location. Conveniently speaking, this error displays the unavailability of a location for an Apple iPhone 15 Plus, which is why it shows such an error. This can be frustrating, especially if you’re trying to locate a lost or stolen device. However, there are several reasons why this error may occur, and understanding them will help you troubleshoot the issue effectively.

### 2.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 15 Plus Say, "No Location Found"?

There are a few common reasons why your Apple iPhone 15 Plus may display the “No Location Found” error message. In this section, we will explore these reasons and provide solutions to help you resolve the issue.

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One possible reason for the “No Location Found” error is that your Location Services are disabled. To check if this is the case, go to your Apple iPhone 15 Plus’s Settings, tap on Privacy, and select Location Services. Ensure that the toggle switch is turned on for both the Find My app and any other apps that require location access.

  • 2. Location Not Being Shared

If you cannot find the location of your friend across the Find My App, there is a possibility that they’ve stopped sharing the location at any time. When this happens, you won’t be able to check out their live location coordinates, as the other user has voluntarily abstained from the option of showing their location to someone else.

  • 3. Device Ran Out of Battery

iPhones are Apple iPhone 15 Plus] and other smartphones that can run out of battery. While the Apple iPhone 15 Plus needs to be activated to communicate properly, having the Apple iPhone 15 Plus run out of battery leaves with this error when their location is searched. The Find My app would duly fail to access the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device when it runs out of battery.

  • 4. iCloud Removed from Device

Your iCloud account plays a crucial role in the Find My app’s functionality. Apple iPhone 15 Plus provides the “Share My Location” option for Find My users who have connected their iCloud account with their device.

If somehow they remove the iCloud account from their phone, all connections with the Apple iPhone 15 Plus are deleted. This also includes the Find My service, which eliminates the location services from the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device. You would now be unable to observe any location coordinates of the Apple iPhone 15 Plus device. Sign out of your iCloud account, restart your device, and sign back in to refresh the connection. Additionally, ensure that you have enabled Find My Apple iPhone 15 Plus in your iCloud settings.

  • 5. Poor GPS Signal or No Internet Connection

Another reason for the error message could be a weak GPS signal or lack of internet connectivity. Your Apple iPhone 15 Plus relies on GPS and internet connection to accurately determine its location. If you’re in an area with poor GPS signal or have no internet connection, your device may struggle to find its location. Try moving to an open space or connecting to a stable internet network to see if the issue resolves.

  • 6. Outdated iOS Version

Sometimes, an outdated iOS version can cause issues with location services. Ensure that your Apple iPhone 15 Plus is running on the latest iOS version by going to Settings, selecting General, and tapping on Software Update. If an update is available, download and install it to potentially fix any bugs or glitches affecting the Find My app’s location tracking.

  • 7. Find My Not Working Properly

Glitches in the Find My service can also cause the problem of the “No Location Found” error with the Apple iPhone 15 Plus. You won’t get any location results if the primary source has issues that cannot be quickly resolved. At times, this directs back to the server, which might take some time to correct.

Encountering the “No Location Found” error on your Apple iPhone 15 Plus’s Find My app can be frustrating, but with the information provided in this part, you now have a better understanding of why it occurs and how to troubleshoot it.

Click here
## Part 3: "No Location Found" vs. "Location Not Available" in Find My App

The “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” errors have a very thin line of difference among them. While both errors involve the inaccessibility of the location services, some causes also display similarities among them. However, there still is a difference in the errors, which is marked by the following table. With the presented distinctions, you can specify the difference between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available.”

Fake GPS Location on iOS and Android in One Click!

What is the Difference Between Location Unavailable and No Location Found?

No Location FoundLocation Not Available / Location Unavailable
Occurs when Apple iPhone 15 Plus is turned off or is offlineThe Find My App is turned on but is failing to update the user’s current location.
The device will be blank in color.The device will have a color and will not be generic.
Location Services across the Apple iPhone 15 Plus might not be turned on.The “Location Services” and “Share My Location” features on Apple iPhone 15 Plus are active and running.
It does not update the location of the person in seconds.The location is updated within seconds once the service is resumed.

In summary, “Location not available” typically refers to the temporary unavailability of location data from a device, while “No location found” indicates the inability to locate a specific device or individual at the given time.

Part 4: How to Fix “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” in Find My App?

We shall now start with an overview of the fixes that can be utilized to resolve the location errors in the Find My App. While the provided solutions are pretty comprehensive, different solutions can be appropriate for both problems. Thus, keep a check on the fixes and select the best option that suits your nature.

Fix 1: Checking the Apple’s System Status Page

The first thing you can do to check the location problems across the Apple iPhone 15 Plus is to look into the status of Find My across Apple servers through Apple’s System Status page. Before you lead to perform any other action across your Apple iPhone 15 Plus, it is highly possible that the problem lies across the Apple Servers. If the service is not operational, you will find a red or yellow dot across it. Find My can be down, which is why all location errors occur across your Apple iPhone 15 Plus. For that, you have to wait for a while before the service starts running again.

### Fix 2: Change the Network Connections to Refreshing Network Settings

It is not vital to go for complicated procedures from the very start to resolve the problems of “No Location Found Apple iPhone 15 Plus”. entry.title: In 2024, Find My App Troubleshooting No Location Found vs. Location Not Available & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 15 | Dr.fone
entry.content:
Find My App Troubleshooting: ‘No Location Found’ vs. ‘Location Not Available’ & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 15

“What does it mean when someone’s location on Apple iPhone 15 suddenly shows “Location Not Available”? Why does it say no location found on Find My Apple iPhone 15?”

On Quora, there are many similar questions as above. Do you have the same question?

The Find My app on Apple iPhone 15 has become a powerful tool for locating lost or misplaced devices and tracking the location of family and friends. While using the app, encountering messages like “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” could be quite challenging. Understanding the distinctions between these messages within the Find My app is crucial for effectively managing and understanding location information.

In this article, we will explore the differences between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” within the Find My app on Apple iPhone 15 and will potentially address solutions to these problems.

Part 1: What Does “Location Not Available” Mean in Find My App?

If you are an Apple iPhone 15 user and frequently use the Find My app to track the location of your devices or loved ones, you may have come across the frustrating message that says “Location Not Available.” This error can leave you puzzled and wondering why you are unable to see the real-time location of the Apple iPhone 15 device you are tracking.

1.1 Understanding the “Location Not Available” Error

iPhone returning with the error “Location Not Available” involves issues caused by the Apple iPhone 15 device’s GPS. “Location Not Available” in the Find My app typically means that the Apple iPhone 15 device you are trying to locate is either turned off, not connected to the internet, or has disabled location services.

When a device is turned off or not connected to the internet, it cannot send its location information to the Find My app, thus resulting in the “Location Not Available” message. Similarly, if the Apple iPhone 15 device has disabled location services, it will not be able to provide its location to the app. It’s important to note that this message does not necessarily mean that the Apple iPhone 15 device is lost or stolen, but rather that it is unable to be tracked at that moment.

### 1.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 15 Say, "Location Not Available"?

The “Location Not Available” message can appear on the Find My app for various reasons. Here are some possible explanations:

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One common reason for this error is that the Apple iPhone 15 device you are trying to locate has its location services turned off. Location services are essential for apps like Find My to accurately determine the Apple iPhone 15 device’s location. To resolve this issue, the Apple iPhone 15 device owner needs to enable location services in their device settings.

  • 2. Poor or No Internet Connection

The Find My app relies on a stable internet connection to transmit location data. If the Apple iPhone 15 device you are tracking is in an area with weak or no internet connectivity, the app may not be able to retrieve the location information. Encourage the Apple iPhone 15 device owner to check their internet connection and try again later. In another case, it might be possible that your phone’s Airplane Mode is turned on, with the Wi-Fi services and cellular data turned off for the Apple iPhone 15.

  • 3. Incorrect Date and Time Settings

The “Date & Time Settings” of the Apple iPhone 15 are not set properly. You may have tried to manually set the date, time, and the appropriate zone that the Apple iPhone 15 has to follow. Technical anomalies across the settings will cause issues with the Apple iPhone 15 device’s location settings.

  • 4. Privacy Settings

Apple prioritizes user privacy, and as a result, users have control over sharing their location information. If the person you are trying to locate has set their privacy settings to restrict location sharing, you will receive a “Location Not Available” message. In this case, the Apple iPhone 15 device owner needs to adjust their privacy settings to allow location sharing with the Find My app.

  • 5. Device Turned Off or Battery Depleted

If the Apple iPhone 15 device you are tracking is turned off or its battery has completely drained, the Find My app will not be able to provide the location information. This is a common occurrence when trying to locate a lost or stolen device. In such cases, you may need to wait until the Apple iPhone 15 device is turned on or charged to retrieve its location.

  • 6. Problems with Application or Device

Occasionally, technical glitches or temporary server issues can cause the “Location Not Available” error, which will require a restart of the Apple iPhone 15 device. System issues can also cause glitches in functions like the location settings of the Apple iPhone 15, which need to be restarted. If the error persists for an extended period, it may be worth contacting Apple support for further assistance.

In conclusion, the “Location Not Available” error in the Find My app can be caused by a variety of factors, including disabled location services, poor internet connection, privacy settings, device status, or technical glitches. By understanding these possible reasons, you can troubleshoot the issue more effectively and ensure a seamless tracking experience.

Part 2: What Does “No Location Found” Mean in Find My App?

The Find My app is a useful tool that allows you to locate your Apple iPhone 15, iPad, or other Apple devices. It uses a combination of GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular data to pinpoint the exact location of your device. However, there are instances where the app fails to provide a location, leaving users confused and concerned.

2.1 Understanding the “No Location Found” Error

The “No Location Found” error message on your Find My app indicates that your Apple iPhone 15 is unable to determine its current location. Conveniently speaking, this error displays the unavailability of a location for an Apple iPhone 15, which is why it shows such an error. This can be frustrating, especially if you’re trying to locate a lost or stolen device. However, there are several reasons why this error may occur, and understanding them will help you troubleshoot the issue effectively.

Click here
### 2.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 15 Say, "No Location Found"?

There are a few common reasons why your Apple iPhone 15 may display the “No Location Found” error message. In this section, we will explore these reasons and provide solutions to help you resolve the issue.

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One possible reason for the “No Location Found” error is that your Location Services are disabled. To check if this is the case, go to your Apple iPhone 15’s Settings, tap on Privacy, and select Location Services. Ensure that the toggle switch is turned on for both the Find My app and any other apps that require location access.

  • 2. Location Not Being Shared

If you cannot find the location of your friend across the Find My App, there is a possibility that they’ve stopped sharing the location at any time. When this happens, you won’t be able to check out their live location coordinates, as the other user has voluntarily abstained from the option of showing their location to someone else.

  • 3. Device Ran Out of Battery

iPhones are Apple iPhone 15] and other smartphones that can run out of battery. While the Apple iPhone 15 needs to be activated to communicate properly, having the Apple iPhone 15 run out of battery leaves with this error when their location is searched. The Find My app would duly fail to access the Apple iPhone 15 device when it runs out of battery.

  • 4. iCloud Removed from Device

Your iCloud account plays a crucial role in the Find My app’s functionality. Apple iPhone 15 provides the “Share My Location” option for Find My users who have connected their iCloud account with their device.

If somehow they remove the iCloud account from their phone, all connections with the Apple iPhone 15 are deleted. This also includes the Find My service, which eliminates the location services from the Apple iPhone 15 device. You would now be unable to observe any location coordinates of the Apple iPhone 15 device. Sign out of your iCloud account, restart your device, and sign back in to refresh the connection. Additionally, ensure that you have enabled Find My Apple iPhone 15 in your iCloud settings.

  • 5. Poor GPS Signal or No Internet Connection

Another reason for the error message could be a weak GPS signal or lack of internet connectivity. Your Apple iPhone 15 relies on GPS and internet connection to accurately determine its location. If you’re in an area with poor GPS signal or have no internet connection, your device may struggle to find its location. Try moving to an open space or connecting to a stable internet network to see if the issue resolves.

  • 6. Outdated iOS Version

Sometimes, an outdated iOS version can cause issues with location services. Ensure that your Apple iPhone 15 is running on the latest iOS version by going to Settings, selecting General, and tapping on Software Update. If an update is available, download and install it to potentially fix any bugs or glitches affecting the Find My app’s location tracking.

  • 7. Find My Not Working Properly

Glitches in the Find My service can also cause the problem of the “No Location Found” error with the Apple iPhone 15. You won’t get any location results if the primary source has issues that cannot be quickly resolved. At times, this directs back to the server, which might take some time to correct.

Encountering the “No Location Found” error on your Apple iPhone 15’s Find My app can be frustrating, but with the information provided in this part, you now have a better understanding of why it occurs and how to troubleshoot it.

Part 3: “No Location Found” vs. “Location Not Available” in Find My App

The “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” errors have a very thin line of difference among them. While both errors involve the inaccessibility of the location services, some causes also display similarities among them. However, there still is a difference in the errors, which is marked by the following table. With the presented distinctions, you can specify the difference between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available.”

Fake GPS Location on iOS and Android in One Click!

What is the Difference Between Location Unavailable and No Location Found?

No Location FoundLocation Not Available / Location Unavailable
Occurs when Apple iPhone 15 is turned off or is offlineThe Find My App is turned on but is failing to update the user’s current location.
The device will be blank in color.The device will have a color and will not be generic.
Location Services across the Apple iPhone 15 might not be turned on.The “Location Services” and “Share My Location” features on Apple iPhone 15 are active and running.
It does not update the location of the person in seconds.The location is updated within seconds once the service is resumed.

In summary, “Location not available” typically refers to the temporary unavailability of location data from a device, while “No location found” indicates the inability to locate a specific device or individual at the given time.

Part 4: How to Fix “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” in Find My App?

We shall now start with an overview of the fixes that can be utilized to resolve the location errors in the Find My App. While the provided solutions are pretty comprehensive, different solutions can be appropriate for both problems. Thus, keep a check on the fixes and select the best option that suits your nature.

Fix 1: Checking the Apple’s System Status Page

The first thing you can do to check the location problems across the Apple iPhone 15 is to look into the status of Find My across Apple servers through Apple’s System Status page. Before you lead to perform any other action across your Apple iPhone 15, it is highly possible that the problem lies across the Apple Servers. If the service is not operational, you will find a red or yellow dot across it. Find My can be down, which is why all location errors occur across your Apple iPhone 15. For that, you have to wait for a while before the service starts running again.

Fix 2: Change the Network Connections to Refreshing Network Settings

It is not vital to go for complicated procedures from the very start to resolve the problems of “No Location Found Apple iPhone 15”. You can seek the resolution of this problem across the network settings of your Apple iPhone 15. First, if you’ve connected your Apple iPhone 15 to a Wi-Fi network, you can shift to the cellular data network or another Wi-Fi network. Try turning off and on the services to resolve the problems across them. Changing the network settings would be effective in fixing location errors if they occur due to network inefficiencies.

_**Tips:** Fortunately, there is a reliable solution to fix this issue and get your Find My App back on track. [Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS)](https://drfone.wondershare.com/ios-system-repair.html) is a powerful tool specifically designed to troubleshoot and repair various iOS system issues, including problems with the Find My App. With just a few simple steps, you can quickly resolve the "location not available" or "no location found" error and regain full functionality of the app. Let's explore [how Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS) can help you overcome this frustrating problem](https://drfone.wondershare.com/virtual-location/no-location-found-vs-location-not-available.html#Part5.8)._ ### Fix 3: Turn Off the Airplane Mode across Your Apple iPhone 15

‘Does “No Location Found” mean their phone died’ is the question one might have if they face location errors while looking for their exact location. This might not be the case, as it is possible that one might have left their Airplane Mode on. Thus, the only best way to avoid this is to turn off the Airplane mode across the Apple iPhone 15. To execute this flawlessly, you need to look ahead to these simple steps:

Step 1: Access the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 15 to open the list of options available. Lead through them to find “Airplane Mode” in the list.

**Step 2:** You have to turn off the toggle adjacent to the "Airplane Mode" option for turning it off.

### Fix 4: Set the Appropriate Date and Time of the Phone

The date and time settings are essential in defining the Apple iPhone 15’s location. Having the correct date and time settings is vital in avoiding issues like “Location Not Available” on your Apple iPhone 15. To prevent this from happening, you have to set the date and time of your Apple iPhone 15, which can be done as follows:

Step 1: Open the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 15 and look for “General” settings in the list of options.

Step 2: As you lead next, find the “Date & Time” settings in the options to access your Apple iPhone 15’s date and time settings.

Step 3: You must turn off the toggle adjacent to the “Set Automatically” option. Next, proceed to the “Time Zone” option and find the name of your city to specify the time correctly.

Fix 5: Try Restarting Your Apple iPhone 15

If the location errors are not resolving under any defined solution, you might have to restart your Apple iPhone 15. This fixes all the prevailing glitches within the Apple iPhone 15 device, and it would be best to restart your device. However, the steps for restarting the Apple iPhone 15 differ depending on your model. Let’s look into the instructions to understand the prevailing differences:

For Apple iPhone 15 with Home Button

Step 1: To turn off an Apple iPhone 15 with the Home button, you have to hold the “Power” button on the side.

Step 2: This opens a new screen where you have to turn off the Apple iPhone 15 with the slider. As it turns off, use the Power button to start the Apple iPhone 15 again.

For Apple iPhone 15 without Home Button

Step 1: Apple iPhone 15s without the Home button can be turned off using any “Volume” button and the “Power” button. You have to hold both buttons simultaneously until the slider screen appears.

**Step 2:** Once you turn off the Apple iPhone 15, you need to wait a few seconds and start the Apple iPhone 15 by holding the Power button for a few seconds. ### Fix 6: Enable Location Services From Apple iPhone 15 Settings

‘Does “No Location Found” mean they stopped sharing’ might be the question you would seek when you constantly are facing issues with finding a location across the Find My app. This is quite possible as the Location Services across the Apple iPhone 15 might be turned off for no particular reason. To resolve this problem, you have to follow the resolution to this problem with the following steps:

Step 1: Launch the “Settings” application on the Apple iPhone 15 and proceed into the “Privacy & Security” settings available in the list.

Step 2: As you lead into the next screen, find “Location Services” among the options. On accessing the “Location Services” settings, ensure that the toggle adjacent to the “Location Services” option is turned on.

### Fix 7: Turning On Precise Location on Apple iPhone 15

As location issues across the Apple iPhone 15 involve the location settings, you can also look into the “Precise Location” option for resolving the prevailing problems of the Apple iPhone 15. To execute this properly and avoid all pertinent issues that are preventing you from getting a proper location across Find My, you must follow the steps to turn on Precise Location on your Apple iPhone 15:

Step 1: You must open the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 15 and search for the “Privacy & Security” option within the menu. Next, redirect to the “Location Services” section and turn it on with the available toggle.

Click here
**Step 2:** Following this, you need to scroll down in the same section and look for "Find My" in the options. As you proceed next, you must confirm that the blue tick is across the "Ask Time or When I Share" or "While Using the App" option. Next, ensure that the toggle of "Precise Location" is turned on.

### Fix 8: Quickly Fix Find My App Location Not Available or No Location Found Error

Considering there is no particular solution that resolves the problems of location settings across your Apple iPhone 15, you need to have a contingency plan prepared for it. Rather than taking some extreme measures, you can have the option of fixing this issue with the help of Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS) . Dr.Fone - System Repair (iOS) provides the facility of keeping the Apple iPhone 15 device’s data intact while resolving all the issues that are stopping it from functioning efficiently. You can consider using this tool to solve location issues and errors across Find My.

Part 5: Frequently Asked Questions about Find My App on Apple iPhone 15

Are you having trouble understanding how the Find My App works on your Apple iPhone 15? Do you have questions about certain error messages or how to share your location with others? In this part, we will answer some frequently asked questions about the Find My App on Apple iPhone 15 to help you navigate through its features and functions. Whether you’re experiencing issues with “Location Not Available” or want to know how to prevent your phone from being tracked, we’ve got you covered. Read on to find the answers to your burning questions about the Find My App.

### 1\. Does "Location Not Available" Mean They Turned It Off?

Yes, if you are facing the problem of “Location Not Available” while using the Find My service, it might be related to the Apple iPhone 15 device being turned off. However, this is not the only case, as other issues might lead to such an error, such as networking errors and software glitches.

2. Does “No Location Found” Mean They Stopped Sharing?

Yes, if you are facing the problem of “No Location Found” while searching for a location, it might mean that the user has stopped sharing it. However, there can be other anomalies, such as the unnecessary closure of some functions or other software problems that lead to such location errors.

Click here
### 3\. How to Freeze Location on Find My Apple iPhone 15?

If you wish to freeze the location on Find My app, you will have to open the “Privacy & Security” settings on your Apple iPhone 15 and close down the Location Services to freeze the location.

4. How to Prevent Your Apple iPhone 15 from Being Tracked?

To prevent getting tracked, you can use the Dr.Fone - Virtual Location tool to spoof your Apple iPhone 15 location anywhere in the world. This is how you can prevent other users from tracking your location.

Tips: With Dr.Fone - Virtual Location (iOS/Android) you can freely change your GPS location to anywhere without jailbreak! Also, it enables you to simulate GPS movement with the joystick, customized speeds, and imported GPX route files.

5. How to Share Your Location with Someone in Find My App?

To share your location with someone in Find My app, follow these steps:

  • Step 1. Open the Find My app on your device. This app is available on Apple iPhone 15, iPad, and Mac.
  • Step 2. Tap on the “People” tab at the bottom of the screen.
  • Step 3. Tap on the “Share My Location” button.
  • Step 4. Select the contact you want to share your location with from your contacts list. If the person you want to share your location with is not in your contacts, you can manually enter their phone number or email address.
  • Step 5. Choose the duration for which you want to share your location. You can choose to share your location indefinitely or for a specific period of time.
  • Step 6. Tap on “Send” to share your location with the selected contact.

The person you shared your location with will receive a notification and will be able to see your location in the Find My app. They can also choose to share their location with you, allowing both of you to easily track each other’s whereabouts.

It’s important to note that you have control over who can see your location and for how long. You can stop sharing your location at any time by going back to the “People” tab and tapping on “Stop Sharing My Location” for the specific contact.

### 6\. How Do You Know When Someone Stops Sharing Their Location on Apple iPhone 15?

To know when someone stops sharing their location on Apple iPhone 15, you can follow these steps:

  • Step 1. Open the Find My app on your Apple iPhone 15.
  • Step 2. Tap on the “People” tab at the bottom of the screen.
  • Step 3. Look for the person whose location you want to track. If their location is being shared with you, their name should appear in the list.
  • Step 4. If the person has stopped sharing their location, their name will no longer appear in the list or their location will be shown as “Location Not Available.”

Alternatively, you can also try sending them a message or giving them a call to confirm if they have stopped sharing their location intentionally or if there might be any technical issues. It’s important to respect their privacy and not make any assumptions without proper communication.

entry.content:
Find My App Troubleshooting: ‘No Location Found’ vs. ‘Location Not Available’ & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max

“What does it mean when someone’s location on Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max suddenly shows “Location Not Available”? Why does it say no location found on Find My Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max?”

On Quora, there are many similar questions as above. Do you have the same question?

The Find My app on Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max has become a powerful tool for locating lost or misplaced devices and tracking the location of family and friends. While using the app, encountering messages like “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” could be quite challenging. Understanding the distinctions between these messages within the Find My app is crucial for effectively managing and understanding location information.

In this article, we will explore the differences between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” within the Find My app on Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max and will potentially address solutions to these problems.

Part 1: What Does “Location Not Available” Mean in Find My App?

If you are an Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max user and frequently use the Find My app to track the location of your devices or loved ones, you may have come across the frustrating message that says “Location Not Available.” This error can leave you puzzled and wondering why you are unable to see the real-time location of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device you are tracking.

1.1 Understanding the “Location Not Available” Error

iPhone returning with the error “Location Not Available” involves issues caused by the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device’s GPS. “Location Not Available” in the Find My app typically means that the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device you are trying to locate is either turned off, not connected to the internet, or has disabled location services.

When a device is turned off or not connected to the internet, it cannot send its location information to the Find My app, thus resulting in the “Location Not Available” message. Similarly, if the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device has disabled location services, it will not be able to provide its location to the app. It’s important to note that this message does not necessarily mean that the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device is lost or stolen, but rather that it is unable to be tracked at that moment.

1.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max Say, “Location Not Available”?

The “Location Not Available” message can appear on the Find My app for various reasons. Here are some possible explanations:

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One common reason for this error is that the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device you are trying to locate has its location services turned off. Location services are essential for apps like Find My to accurately determine the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device’s location. To resolve this issue, the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device owner needs to enable location services in their device settings.

  • 2. Poor or No Internet Connection

The Find My app relies on a stable internet connection to transmit location data. If the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device you are tracking is in an area with weak or no internet connectivity, the app may not be able to retrieve the location information. Encourage the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device owner to check their internet connection and try again later. In another case, it might be possible that your phone’s Airplane Mode is turned on, with the Wi-Fi services and cellular data turned off for the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max.

  • 3. Incorrect Date and Time Settings

The “Date & Time Settings” of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max are not set properly. You may have tried to manually set the date, time, and the appropriate zone that the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max has to follow. Technical anomalies across the settings will cause issues with the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device’s location settings.

  • 4. Privacy Settings

Apple prioritizes user privacy, and as a result, users have control over sharing their location information. If the person you are trying to locate has set their privacy settings to restrict location sharing, you will receive a “Location Not Available” message. In this case, the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device owner needs to adjust their privacy settings to allow location sharing with the Find My app.

  • 5. Device Turned Off or Battery Depleted

If the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device you are tracking is turned off or its battery has completely drained, the Find My app will not be able to provide the location information. This is a common occurrence when trying to locate a lost or stolen device. In such cases, you may need to wait until the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device is turned on or charged to retrieve its location.

  • 6. Problems with Application or Device

Occasionally, technical glitches or temporary server issues can cause the “Location Not Available” error, which will require a restart of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device. System issues can also cause glitches in functions like the location settings of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max, which need to be restarted. If the error persists for an extended period, it may be worth contacting Apple support for further assistance.

In conclusion, the “Location Not Available” error in the Find My app can be caused by a variety of factors, including disabled location services, poor internet connection, privacy settings, device status, or technical glitches. By understanding these possible reasons, you can troubleshoot the issue more effectively and ensure a seamless tracking experience.

## Part 2: What Does "No Location Found" Mean in Find My App?

The Find My app is a useful tool that allows you to locate your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max, iPad, or other Apple devices. It uses a combination of GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular data to pinpoint the exact location of your device. However, there are instances where the app fails to provide a location, leaving users confused and concerned.

### 2.1 Understanding the "No Location Found" Error

The “No Location Found” error message on your Find My app indicates that your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max is unable to determine its current location. Conveniently speaking, this error displays the unavailability of a location for an Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max, which is why it shows such an error. This can be frustrating, especially if you’re trying to locate a lost or stolen device. However, there are several reasons why this error may occur, and understanding them will help you troubleshoot the issue effectively.

### 2.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max Say, "No Location Found"?

There are a few common reasons why your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max may display the “No Location Found” error message. In this section, we will explore these reasons and provide solutions to help you resolve the issue.

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One possible reason for the “No Location Found” error is that your Location Services are disabled. To check if this is the case, go to your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max’s Settings, tap on Privacy, and select Location Services. Ensure that the toggle switch is turned on for both the Find My app and any other apps that require location access.

  • 2. Location Not Being Shared

If you cannot find the location of your friend across the Find My App, there is a possibility that they’ve stopped sharing the location at any time. When this happens, you won’t be able to check out their live location coordinates, as the other user has voluntarily abstained from the option of showing their location to someone else.

  • 3. Device Ran Out of Battery

iPhones are Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max] and other smartphones that can run out of battery. While the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max needs to be activated to communicate properly, having the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max run out of battery leaves with this error when their location is searched. The Find My app would duly fail to access the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device when it runs out of battery.

  • 4. iCloud Removed from Device

Your iCloud account plays a crucial role in the Find My app’s functionality. Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max provides the “Share My Location” option for Find My users who have connected their iCloud account with their device.

If somehow they remove the iCloud account from their phone, all connections with the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max are deleted. This also includes the Find My service, which eliminates the location services from the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device. You would now be unable to observe any location coordinates of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max device. Sign out of your iCloud account, restart your device, and sign back in to refresh the connection. Additionally, ensure that you have enabled Find My Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max in your iCloud settings.

  • 5. Poor GPS Signal or No Internet Connection

Another reason for the error message could be a weak GPS signal or lack of internet connectivity. Your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max relies on GPS and internet connection to accurately determine its location. If you’re in an area with poor GPS signal or have no internet connection, your device may struggle to find its location. Try moving to an open space or connecting to a stable internet network to see if the issue resolves.

  • 6. Outdated iOS Version

Sometimes, an outdated iOS version can cause issues with location services. Ensure that your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max is running on the latest iOS version by going to Settings, selecting General, and tapping on Software Update. If an update is available, download and install it to potentially fix any bugs or glitches affecting the Find My app’s location tracking.

  • 7. Find My Not Working Properly

Glitches in the Find My service can also cause the problem of the “No Location Found” error with the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max. You won’t get any location results if the primary source has issues that cannot be quickly resolved. At times, this directs back to the server, which might take some time to correct.

Encountering the “No Location Found” error on your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max’s Find My app can be frustrating, but with the information provided in this part, you now have a better understanding of why it occurs and how to troubleshoot it.

## Part 3: "No Location Found" vs. "Location Not Available" in Find My App

The “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” errors have a very thin line of difference among them. While both errors involve the inaccessibility of the location services, some causes also display similarities among them. However, there still is a difference in the errors, which is marked by the following table. With the presented distinctions, you can specify the difference between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available.”

Fake GPS Location on iOS and Android in One Click!

What is the Difference Between Location Unavailable and No Location Found?

No Location FoundLocation Not Available / Location Unavailable
Occurs when Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max is turned off or is offlineThe Find My App is turned on but is failing to update the user’s current location.
The device will be blank in color.The device will have a color and will not be generic.
Location Services across the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max might not be turned on.The “Location Services” and “Share My Location” features on Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max are active and running.
It does not update the location of the person in seconds.The location is updated within seconds once the service is resumed.

In summary, “Location not available” typically refers to the temporary unavailability of location data from a device, while “No location found” indicates the inability to locate a specific device or individual at the given time.

Part 4: How to Fix “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” in Find My App?

We shall now start with an overview of the fixes that can be utilized to resolve the location errors in the Find My App. While the provided solutions are pretty comprehensive, different solutions can be appropriate for both problems. Thus, keep a check on the fixes and select the best option that suits your nature.

### Fix 1: Checking the Apple's System Status Page

The first thing you can do to check the location problems across the Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max is to look into the status of Find My across Apple servers through Apple’s System Status page. Before you lead to perform any other action across your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max, it is highly possible that the problem lies across the Apple Servers. If the service is not operational, you will find a red or yellow dot across it. Find My can be down, which is why all location errors occur across your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max. For that, you have to wait for a while before the service starts running again.

### Fix 2: Change the Network Connections to Refreshing Network Settings

It is not vital to go for complicated procedures from the very start to resolve the problems of “No Location Found Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max”. You can seek the resolution of this problem across the network settings of your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max. First, if you’ve connected your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max to a Wi-Fi network, you can shift to the cellular data network or another Wi-Fi network. Try turning off and on the services to resolve the problems across them. Changing the network settings would be effective in fixing location errors if they occur due to network inefficiencies.

_**Tips:** Fortunately, there is a reliable solution to fix this issue and get your Find My App back on track. Fix 3: Turn Off the Airplane Mode across Your Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max

The Find My app on Apple iPhone 14 Pro has become a powerful tool for locating lost or misplaced devices and tracking the location of family and friends. While using the app, encountering messages like “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” could be quite challenging. Understanding the distinctions between these messages within the Find My app is crucial for effectively managing and understanding location information.

In this article, we will explore the differences between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” within the Find My app on Apple iPhone 14 Pro and will potentially address solutions to these problems.

Part 1: What Does “Location Not Available” Mean in Find My App?

If you are an Apple iPhone 14 Pro user and frequently use the Find My app to track the location of your devices or loved ones, you may have come across the frustrating message that says “Location Not Available.” This error can leave you puzzled and wondering why you are unable to see the real-time location of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device you are tracking.

1.1 Understanding the “Location Not Available” Error

iPhone returning with the error “Location Not Available” involves issues caused by the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device’s GPS. “Location Not Available” in the Find My app typically means that the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device you are trying to locate is either turned off, not connected to the internet, or has disabled location services.

When a device is turned off or not connected to the internet, it cannot send its location information to the Find My app, thus resulting in the “Location Not Available” message. Similarly, if the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device has disabled location services, it will not be able to provide its location to the app. It’s important to note that this message does not necessarily mean that the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device is lost or stolen, but rather that it is unable to be tracked at that moment.

1.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 14 Pro Say, “Location Not Available”?

The “Location Not Available” message can appear on the Find My app for various reasons. Here are some possible explanations:

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One common reason for this error is that the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device you are trying to locate has its location services turned off. Location services are essential for apps like Find My to accurately determine the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device’s location. To resolve this issue, the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device owner needs to enable location services in their device settings.

  • 2. Poor or No Internet Connection

The Find My app relies on a stable internet connection to transmit location data. If the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device you are tracking is in an area with weak or no internet connectivity, the app may not be able to retrieve the location information. Encourage the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device owner to check their internet connection and try again later. In another case, it might be possible that your phone’s Airplane Mode is turned on, with the Wi-Fi services and cellular data turned off for the Apple iPhone 14 Pro.

  • 3. Incorrect Date and Time Settings

The “Date & Time Settings” of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro are not set properly. You may have tried to manually set the date, time, and the appropriate zone that the Apple iPhone 14 Pro has to follow. Technical anomalies across the settings will cause issues with the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device’s location settings.

  • 4. Privacy Settings

Apple prioritizes user privacy, and as a result, users have control over sharing their location information. If the person you are trying to locate has set their privacy settings to restrict location sharing, you will receive a “Location Not Available” message. In this case, the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device owner needs to adjust their privacy settings to allow location sharing with the Find My app.

  • 5. Device Turned Off or Battery Depleted

If the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device you are tracking is turned off or its battery has completely drained, the Find My app will not be able to provide the location information. This is a common occurrence when trying to locate a lost or stolen device. In such cases, you may need to wait until the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device is turned on or charged to retrieve its location.

  • 6. Problems with Application or Device

Occasionally, technical glitches or temporary server issues can cause the “Location Not Available” error, which will require a restart of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device. System issues can also cause glitches in functions like the location settings of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro, which need to be restarted. If the error persists for an extended period, it may be worth contacting Apple support for further assistance.

In conclusion, the “Location Not Available” error in the Find My app can be caused by a variety of factors, including disabled location services, poor internet connection, privacy settings, device status, or technical glitches. By understanding these possible reasons, you can troubleshoot the issue more effectively and ensure a seamless tracking experience.

## Part 2: What Does "No Location Found" Mean in Find My App?

The Find My app is a useful tool that allows you to locate your Apple iPhone 14 Pro, iPad, or other Apple devices. It uses a combination of GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular data to pinpoint the exact location of your device. However, there are instances where the app fails to provide a location, leaving users confused and concerned.

2.1 Understanding the “No Location Found” Error

The “No Location Found” error message on your Find My app indicates that your Apple iPhone 14 Pro is unable to determine its current location. Conveniently speaking, this error displays the unavailability of a location for an Apple iPhone 14 Pro, which is why it shows such an error. ### 2.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 14 Pro Say, "No Location Found"?

There are a few common reasons why your Apple iPhone 14 Pro may display the “No Location Found” error message. In this section, we will explore these reasons and provide solutions to help you resolve the issue.

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One possible reason for the “No Location Found” error is that your Location Services are disabled. To check if this is the case, go to your Apple iPhone 14 Pro’s Settings, tap on Privacy, and select Location Services. Ensure that the toggle switch is turned on for both the Find My app and any other apps that require location access.

  • 2. Location Not Being Shared

If you cannot find the location of your friend across the Find My App, there is a possibility that they’ve stopped sharing the location at any time. When this happens, you won’t be able to check out their live location coordinates, as the other user has voluntarily abstained from the option of showing their location to someone else.

  • 3. Device Ran Out of Battery

iPhones are Apple iPhone 14 Pro] and other smartphones that can run out of battery. While the Apple iPhone 14 Pro needs to be activated to communicate properly, having the Apple iPhone 14 Pro run out of battery leaves with this error when their location is searched. The Find My app would duly fail to access the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device when it runs out of battery.

  • 4. iCloud Removed from Device

Your iCloud account plays a crucial role in the Find My app’s functionality. Apple iPhone 14 Pro provides the “Share My Location” option for Find My users who have connected their iCloud account with their device.

If somehow they remove the iCloud account from their phone, all connections with the Apple iPhone 14 Pro are deleted. This also includes the Find My service, which eliminates the location services from the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device. You would now be unable to observe any location coordinates of the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device. Sign out of your iCloud account, restart your device, and sign back in to refresh the connection. Additionally, ensure that you have enabled Find My Apple iPhone 14 Pro in your iCloud settings.

  • 5. Poor GPS Signal or No Internet Connection

Another reason for the error message could be a weak GPS signal or lack of internet connectivity. Your Apple iPhone 14 Pro relies on GPS and internet connection to accurately determine its location. If you’re in an area with poor GPS signal or have no internet connection, your device may struggle to find its location. Try moving to an open space or connecting to a stable internet network to see if the issue resolves.

  • 6. Outdated iOS Version

Sometimes, an outdated iOS version can cause issues with location services. Ensure that your Apple iPhone 14 Pro is running on the latest iOS version by going to Settings, selecting General, and tapping on Software Update. If an update is available, download and install it to potentially fix any bugs or glitches affecting the Find My app’s location tracking.

  • 7. Find My Not Working Properly

Glitches in the Find My service can also cause the problem of the “No Location Found” error with the Apple iPhone 14 Pro. You won’t get any location results if the primary source has issues that cannot be quickly resolved. At times, this directs back to the server, which might take some time to correct.

Encountering the “No Location Found” error on your Apple iPhone 14 Pro’s Find My app can be frustrating, but with the information provided in this part, you now have a better understanding of why it occurs and how to troubleshoot it.

### 1\. Does "Location Not Available" Mean They Turned It Off?

Yes, if you are facing the problem of “Location Not Available” while using the Find My service, it might be related to the Apple iPhone 14 Pro device being turned off. However, this is not the only case, as other issues might lead to such an error, such as networking errors and software glitches.

2. Does “No Location Found” Mean They Stopped Sharing?

Yes, if you are facing the problem of “No Location Found” while searching for a location, it might mean that the user has stopped sharing it. However, there can be other anomalies, such as the unnecessary closure of some functions or other software problems that lead to such location errors.

3. How to Freeze Location on Find My Apple iPhone 14 Pro?

### 5\. How to Share Your Location with Someone in Find My App?

To share your location with someone in Find My app, follow these steps:

  • Step 1. Open the Find My app on your device. This app is available on Apple iPhone 14 Pro, iPad, and Mac.
  • Step 2. Tap on the “People” tab at the bottom of the screen.
  • Step 3. Tap on the “Share My Location” button.
  • Step 4. Select the contact you want to share your location with from your contacts list. If the person you want to share your location with is not in your contacts, you can manually enter their phone number or email address.
  • Step 5. Choose the duration for which you want to share your location. You can choose to share your location indefinitely or for a specific period of time.
  • Step 6. Tap on “Send” to share your location with the selected contact.

The person you shared your location with will receive a notification and will be able to see your location in the Find My app. They can also choose to share their location with you, allowing both of you to easily track each other’s whereabouts.

It’s important to note that you have control over who can see your location and for how long. You can stop sharing your location at any time by going back to the “People” tab and tapping on “Stop Sharing My Location” for the specific contact.

6. How Do You Know When Someone Stops Sharing Their Location on Apple iPhone 14 Pro?

To know when someone stops sharing their location on Apple iPhone 14 Pro, you can follow these steps:

  • Step 1. Open the Find My app on your Apple iPhone 14 Pro.
  • Step 2. Tap on the “People” tab at the bottom of the screen.
  • Step 3. Look for the person whose location you want to track. If their location is being shared with you, their name should appear in the list.
  • Step 4. If the person has stopped sharing their location, their name will no longer appear in the list or their location will be shown as “Location Not Available.”

Alternatively, you can also try sending them a message or giving them a call to confirm if they have stopped sharing their location intentionally or if there might be any technical issues. It’s important to respect their privacy and not make any assumptions without proper communication.

entry.title: In 2024, Find My App Troubleshooting No Location Found vs. Location Not Available & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 14 Plus | Dr.fone
entry.content:
Find My App Troubleshooting: ‘No Location Found’ vs. ‘Location Not Available’ & How to Fix Them On Apple iPhone 14 Plus

“What does it mean when someone’s location on Apple iPhone 14 Plus suddenly shows “Location Not Available”? Why does it say no location found on Find My Apple iPhone 14 Plus?”

On Quora, there are many similar questions as above. Do you have the same question?

The Find My app on Apple iPhone 14 Plus has become a powerful tool for locating lost or misplaced devices and tracking the location of family and friends. While using the app, encountering messages like “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” could be quite challenging. Understanding the distinctions between these messages within the Find My app is crucial for effectively managing and understanding location information.

In this article, we will explore the differences between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” within the Find My app on Apple iPhone 14 Plus and will potentially address solutions to these problems.

Part 1: What Does “Location Not Available” Mean in Find My App?

If you are an Apple iPhone 14 Plus user and frequently use the Find My app to track the location of your devices or loved ones, you may have come across the frustrating message that says “Location Not Available.” This error can leave you puzzled and wondering why you are unable to see the real-time location of the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device you are tracking.

1.1 Understanding the “Location Not Available” Error

iPhone returning with the error “Location Not Available” involves issues caused by the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device’s GPS. “Location Not Available” in the Find My app typically means that the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device you are trying to locate is either turned off, not connected to the internet, or has disabled location services.

When a device is turned off or not connected to the internet, it cannot send its location information to the Find My app, thus resulting in the “Location Not Available” message. Similarly, if the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device has disabled location services, it will not be able to provide its location to the app. It’s important to note that this message does not necessarily mean that the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device is lost or stolen, but rather that it is unable to be tracked at that moment.

### 1.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 14 Plus Say, "Location Not Available"?

The “Location Not Available” message can appear on the Find My app for various reasons. Here are some possible explanations:

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One common reason for this error is that the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device you are trying to locate has its location services turned off. Location services are essential for apps like Find My to accurately determine the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device’s location. To resolve this issue, the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device owner needs to enable location services in their device settings.

  • 2. Poor or No Internet Connection

The Find My app relies on a stable internet connection to transmit location data. If the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device you are tracking is in an area with weak or no internet connectivity, the app may not be able to retrieve the location information. Encourage the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device owner to check their internet connection and try again later. In another case, it might be possible that your phone’s Airplane Mode is turned on, with the Wi-Fi services and cellular data turned off for the Apple iPhone 14 Plus.

  • 3. Incorrect Date and Time Settings

The “Date & Time Settings” of the Apple iPhone 14 Plus are not set properly. You may have tried to manually set the date, time, and the appropriate zone that the Apple iPhone 14 Plus has to follow. Technical anomalies across the settings will cause issues with the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device’s location settings.

  • 4. Privacy Settings

Apple prioritizes user privacy, and as a result, users have control over sharing their location information. If the person you are trying to locate has set their privacy settings to restrict location sharing, you will receive a “Location Not Available” message. In this case, the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device owner needs to adjust their privacy settings to allow location sharing with the Find My app.

  • 5. Device Turned Off or Battery Depleted

If the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device you are tracking is turned off or its battery has completely drained, the Find My app will not be able to provide the location information. This is a common occurrence when trying to locate a lost or stolen device. In such cases, you may need to wait until the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device is turned on or charged to retrieve its location.

  • 6. Problems with Application or Device

Occasionally, technical glitches or temporary server issues can cause the “Location Not Available” error, which will require a restart of the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device. System issues can also cause glitches in functions like the location settings of the Apple iPhone 14 Plus, which need to be restarted. If the error persists for an extended period, it may be worth contacting Apple support for further assistance.

In conclusion, the “Location Not Available” error in the Find My app can be caused by a variety of factors, including disabled location services, poor internet connection, privacy settings, device status, or technical glitches. By understanding these possible reasons, you can troubleshoot the issue more effectively and ensure a seamless tracking experience.

Part 2: What Does “No Location Found” Mean in Find My App?

The Find My app is a useful tool that allows you to locate your Apple iPhone 14 Plus, iPad, or other Apple devices. It uses a combination of GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular data to pinpoint the exact location of your device. However, there are instances where the app fails to provide a location, leaving users confused and concerned.

### 2.1 Understanding the "No Location Found" Error

The “No Location Found” error message on your Find My app indicates that your Apple iPhone 14 Plus is unable to determine its current location. Conveniently speaking, this error displays the unavailability of a location for an Apple iPhone 14 Plus, which is why it shows such an error. This can be frustrating, especially if you’re trying to locate a lost or stolen device. However, there are several reasons why this error may occur, and understanding them will help you troubleshoot the issue effectively.

### 2.2 Why Does My Apple iPhone 14 Plus Say, "No Location Found"?

There are a few common reasons why your Apple iPhone 14 Plus may display the “No Location Found” error message. In this section, we will explore these reasons and provide solutions to help you resolve the issue.

  • 1. Location Services Disabled

One possible reason for the “No Location Found” error is that your Location Services are disabled. To check if this is the case, go to your Apple iPhone 14 Plus’s Settings, tap on Privacy, and select Location Services. Ensure that the toggle switch is turned on for both the Find My app and any other apps that require location access.

  • 2. Location Not Being Shared

If you cannot find the location of your friend across the Find My App, there is a possibility that they’ve stopped sharing the location at any time. When this happens, you won’t be able to check out their live location coordinates, as the other user has voluntarily abstained from the option of showing their location to someone else.

  • 3. Device Ran Out of Battery

iPhones are Apple iPhone 14 Plus] and other smartphones that can run out of battery. While the Apple iPhone 14 Plus needs to be activated to communicate properly, having the Apple iPhone 14 Plus run out of battery leaves with this error when their location is searched. The Find My app would duly fail to access the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device when it runs out of battery.

  • 4. iCloud Removed from Device

Your iCloud account plays a crucial role in the Find My app’s functionality. Apple iPhone 14 Plus provides the “Share My Location” option for Find My users who have connected their iCloud account with their device.

If somehow they remove the iCloud account from their phone, all connections with the Apple iPhone 14 Plus are deleted. This also includes the Find My service, which eliminates the location services from the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device. You would now be unable to observe any location coordinates of the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device. Sign out of your iCloud account, restart your device, and sign back in to refresh the connection. Additionally, ensure that you have enabled Find My Apple iPhone 14 Plus in your iCloud settings.

  • 5. Poor GPS Signal or No Internet Connection

Another reason for the error message could be a weak GPS signal or lack of internet connectivity. Your Apple iPhone 14 Plus relies on GPS and internet connection to accurately determine its location. If you’re in an area with poor GPS signal or have no internet connection, your device may struggle to find its location. Try moving to an open space or connecting to a stable internet network to see if the issue resolves.

  • 6. Outdated iOS Version

Sometimes, an outdated iOS version can cause issues with location services. Ensure that your Apple iPhone 14 Plus is running on the latest iOS version by going to Settings, selecting General, and tapping on Software Update. If an update is available, download and install it to potentially fix any bugs or glitches affecting the Find My app’s location tracking.

  • 7. Find My Not Working Properly

Glitches in the Find My service can also cause the problem of the “No Location Found” error with the Apple iPhone 14 Plus. You won’t get any location results if the primary source has issues that cannot be quickly resolved. At times, this directs back to the server, which might take some time to correct.

Encountering the “No Location Found” error on your Apple iPhone 14 Plus’s Find My app can be frustrating, but with the information provided in this part, you now have a better understanding of why it occurs and how to troubleshoot it.

Part 3: “No Location Found” vs. “Location Not Available” in Find My App

The “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available” errors have a very thin line of difference among them. While both errors involve the inaccessibility of the location services, some causes also display similarities among them. However, there still is a difference in the errors, which is marked by the following table. With the presented distinctions, you can specify the difference between “No Location Found” and “Location Not Available.”

Fake GPS Location on iOS and Android in One Click!

### What is the Difference Between Location Unavailable and No Location Found?
No Location FoundLocation Not Available / Location Unavailable
Occurs when Apple iPhone 14 Plus is turned off or is offlineThe Find My App is turned on but is failing to update the user’s current location.
The device will be blank in color.The device will have a color and will not be generic.
Location Services across the Apple iPhone 14 Plus might not be turned on.The “Location Services” and “Share My Location” features on Apple iPhone 14 Plus are active and running.
It does not update the location of the person in seconds.The location is updated within seconds once the service is resumed.

In summary, “Location not available” typically refers to the temporary unavailability of location data from a device, while “No location found” indicates the inability to locate a specific device or individual at the given time.

Part 4: How to Fix “No Location Found” or “Location Not Available” in Find My App?

We shall now start with an overview of the fixes that can be utilized to resolve the location errors in the Find My App. While the provided solutions are pretty comprehensive, different solutions can be appropriate for both problems. Thus, keep a check on the fixes and select the best option that suits your nature.

Fix 1: Checking the Apple’s System Status Page

The first thing you can do to check the location problems across the Apple iPhone 14 Plus is to look into the status of Find My across Apple servers through Apple’s System Status page. Before you lead to perform any other action across your Apple iPhone 14 Plus, it is highly possible that the problem lies across the Apple Servers. If the service is not operational, you will find a red or yellow dot across it. Find My can be down, which is why all location errors occur across your Apple iPhone 14 Plus. For that, you have to wait for a while before the service starts running again.

### Fix 2: Change the Network Connections to Refreshing Network Settings

It is not vital to go for complicated procedures from the very start to resolve the problems of “No Location Found Apple iPhone 14 Plus”. You can seek the resolution of this problem across the network settings of your Apple iPhone 14 Plus. First, if you’ve connected your Apple iPhone 14 Plus to a Wi-Fi network, you can shift to the cellular data network or another Wi-Fi network. Try turning off and on the services to resolve the problems across them. Changing the network settings would be effective in fixing location errors if they occur due to network inefficiencies.

‘Does “No Location Found” mean their phone died’ is the question one might have if they face location errors while looking for their exact location. This might not be the case, as it is possible that one might have left their Airplane Mode on. Thus, the only best way to avoid this is to turn off the Airplane mode across the Apple iPhone 14 Plus. To execute this flawlessly, you need to look ahead to these simple steps:

The date and time settings are essential in defining the Apple iPhone 14 Plus’s location. Having the correct date and time settings is vital in avoiding issues like “Location Not Available” on your Apple iPhone 14 Plus. To prevent this from happening, you have to set the date and time of your Apple iPhone 14 Plus, which can be done as follows:

Step 1: Open the “Settings” of your Apple iPhone 14 Plus and look for “General” settings in the list of options.

Step 2: As you lead next, find the “Date & Time” settings in the options to access your Apple iPhone 14 Plus’s date and time settings.

Step 3: You must turn off the toggle adjacent to the “Set Automatically” option. Next, proceed to the “Time Zone” option and find the name of your city to specify the time correctly.

### Fix 5: Try Restarting Your Apple iPhone 14 Plus

If the location errors are not resolving under any defined solution, you might have to restart your Apple iPhone 14 Plus. This fixes all the prevailing glitches within the Apple iPhone 14 Plus device, and it would be best to restart your device. However, the steps for restarting the Apple iPhone 14 Plus differ depending on your model. Let’s look into the instructions to understand the prevailing differences:

For Apple iPhone 14 Plus with Home Button

Step 1: To turn off an Apple iPhone 14 Plus with the Home button, you have to hold the “Power” button on the side.

Step 2: This opens a new screen where you have to turn off the Apple iPhone 14 Plus with the slider. As it turns off, use the Power button to start the Apple iPhone 14 Plus again.

**For Apple iPhone 14 Plus without Home Button**

Step 1: Apple iPhone 14 Pluss without the Home button can be turned off using any “Volume” button and the “Power” button. You have to hold both buttons simultaneously until the slider screen appears.

Step 2: Once you turn off the Apple iPhone 14 Plus, you need to wait a few seconds and start the Apple iPhone 14 Plus by holding the Power button for a few seconds.

Fix 6: Enable Location Services From Apple iPhone 14 Plus Settings

‘Does “No Location Found” mean they stopped sharing’ might be the question you would seek when you constantly are facing issues with finding a location across the Find My app. This is quite possible as the Location Services across the Apple iPhone 14 Plus might be turned off for no particular reason. To resolve this problem, you have to follow the resolution to this problem with the following steps:

Step 1: Launch the “Settings” application on the Apple iPhone 14 Plus and proceed into the “Privacy & Security” settings available in the list.

Step 2: As you lead into the next screen, find “Location Services” among the options. On accessing the “Location Services” settings, ensure that the toggle adjacent to the “Location Services” option is turned on.

### Fix 7: Turning On Precise Location on Apple iPhone 14 Plus

As location issues across the Apple iPhone 14 Plus involve the location settings, you can also look into the “Precise Location” option for resolving the prevailing problems of the Apple iPhone 14 Plus. To execute this properly and avoid all pertinent issues that are preventing you from getting a proper location across Find My, you must follow the steps to turn on Precise Location on your Apple iPhone 14 Plus:
